The service was attentive and friendly. All in all, we interacted with 5 employees who were all very friendly. My drink never reached the bottom before somebody asked to refill it! 

Plus you have a pretty cool view of the strip to boot. Its a fun, festive atmosphere. I very much enjoyed it. 

Great experience and we will be back!

We had a great waitress. Let us know happy hour was almost over got our order in quickly and even split a drink for us. Food was decent and well priced for the strip. It had a fun vibe. If you go here expecting casual food and atmosphere it's a good choice. The night we went restaurant was full with a long wait but the hostess suggested we sit in the bar since only two of us. It was more than fine. Same food menu.

We come to Las Vegas quite often and as we are not country fans, we found Joanna the bartender to be so awesome. We keep coming back here just to drink and visit with her. This woman is absoulutly the most friendly and warm person. She is a valuable part of your organization. Thanks TI!!!

Country western bar with very attractive servers.  Always enjoy some time here when I am in Vegas.  However the food is not great.  I am from the south and the pulled pork BBQ is a joke here.  The bar area however is fun.  Good beer selection and a great atmosphere.  Sometimes you can people watch and see them ride the mechanical bull.

If you don't like country western though, you may want to avoid.  Also, not much sitting space so you may be standing if it's busy.

Surprise, surprise, the food actually was pretty darn good!

Well, we had a Groupon and so I thought we'd take advantage of it for lunch today.  I had my doubts, since I rarely go down to the Strip and most Strip joints are all sizzle and no substance.

But, I must admit Gilley's turned out A-OK.

We ordered the Sweet Tea to start and boy, it was nasty tasting stuff, so I wasn't expecting too much for the meal.

But, I had the Green Chili and it was really very good and so too was the Mac & Cheese that I had along with the Chili.

Mrs. G enjoyed the Fried Chicken.  It was crisp, moist, and quite tasty.  Her two sides were the good Mac & Cheese and the let's just say not so good Baked Beans.

We had a great seat right on the Strip and the service was friendly and decent.

Ended up going to the casino afterwards and won back my lunch expenditure on TI's dime, since we got free play for new slot club members. Hit enough and a bit more to cover lunch and called it a day.  All-in-all we left happy.

Before I came here, I read some of the reviews and was pretty hesitant about going. But - family came to visit for the weekend and wanted to go here, sooo we tried it out. It's definitely not as bad as some of the reviews say, but I can see how people wouldn't like it. I personally got the pulled pork sandwich, which was different from other ones I've had. It was a lot sweeter, but I enjoyed it. The bread was completely soggy as soon as it was set on the table though, so I was forced to eat it with a fork. The rest of the family thought their meals were pretty good too. The prices were decent for a restaurant directly on the strip and the food was alright. Downside- we asked multiple times if they could change the television directly in front of us to a baseball game. They told us every time they would, but never did. Kind of annoying! Overall, this place is just OK. However, it is a good place to stop at if you're on the strip and want a decent meal and don't feel like spending an outrageous amount of money.

We had a $50 food credit from staying at Treasure Island so we chose to use it here for dinner one night.  We were in Vegas during the week so it wasn't so crowded or insane.  I had the ribs and my boyfriend had the pulled pork.  I had the french fries which were great and the mac and cheese.  That was not as memorable as the shoestring fries but still tasty.  I thought this meal hit the spot.  We turned around in our seats to watch the pirate show outside which was cool.  For an easy and convenient meal, this place fit the bill.

Gilley's really was a lot of fun.  They have a good deal on a bucket of beers and the food is decent (although expensive for what it is).  The best part about Gilley's is definitely the mechanical bull.  I popped my mechanical bull cherry here; I was really nervous but it was a lot of fun, I was even able to stay on for a good minute or so.  

We went to the Bikini Bull Riding contest they have on Sundays, and even though most of the girls seemed like legit volunteers, I know at least one of them worked there.  She's blonde, and they pulled her out of the crowd and she said it was her 21st birthday and that she hadn't ridden a mechanical bull in a very long time.  She then proceeded to strip down and ride the bull like a pro.  She hasn't ridden it in a very long time?  I saw her there the night previous to that riding it and then doing some well-choreographed line dancing.  This girl clearly works at Gilley's in some capacity.  Which is fine, I understand that they need to have some kind of a "show" for this type of thing, but what bothers me is the girl made it to the final 3!  What if she had won?  You're going to give the cash prize to an employee?  I'm still skeptical on whether this contest was rigged or not.  It's a shame.

Got seated and still waiting for a drink/food. Waitress came up dropped a menu and ran off it's been 20 mins since returning back to the table. Still waiting. Plenty of other places to check out and get better service then this dive. Don't waist your time or money Vegas has plenty of other places to go spend time at with top notch service.
Started having a bit of fun then they shutout down and told everyone to leave. Not going back. Just an urban excuse for a good country bar anyways.

We sat in the dining area, which is seperate from the more wild bar and dancing area.  Family friendly, very attentive wait staff, with a great view of the strip.  Food was good, really enjoyed the grits.  The check was surprisingly low being that it is Vegas.  I would definitely return.

I had my doubts about this place since I'm not much into the Urban Cowboy thing, bit the food came highly recommended. We went to the hostess stand by the outside entrance- right in front of the ship- and we were seated in the Strip-side dining area. We were able to do some people-watching and enjoy the food without the mechanical bull. I got the pulled pork burrito with Cole slaw and jalapeno and white cheddar grits and I loved it. The burrito is HUGE!

Sitting near the window and watching people made the time go by since the waiting staff was busy doing who knows what...the waiter finally took our drink requests,15 minutes later,  having an draft beer and a glass of wine, as the drinks arrived. My wife ordered the Fugi chicken salad and I ordered the Skirt steak and fries...absolutely delis! highly recommend...med rare just like the waiter suggested...$20 dollars less than their other high end steak and I'm absolutely sure it couldn't be as tasty as this one. When in the area again will definitely frequent this establishment again...igofish2day out...
P.S. would have been a 5 star if someone would have took our drinks sooner...

If I could give no stars then that would be my choice.   I have no idea what the food or drink selection is because no one ever came by to take our order.  We chose to sit in the bar and there were four of us.. a young couple in mid 20's and my husband and I in our 40's so it wasn't like we were rude or obnoxious.  There weren't a lot of choices to sit close to the bar and the waitress told us to sit anywhere so we had to take a table away from the bar where her and another waiter just stood talking.  We waited for about 5 minutes and no one ever came over to take drink/food orders so we got up and left. There are so many places to choose from in LV that customer service should be top notch.  This bar is located right outside TI so we went inside and ate at Khahunaville  where we were treated like valued patrons.

Very tasteful southern comfort food! 

This was a good stop. We wanted to hang out on the patio, on the strip, watch the world pass by as we ate lunch. However they only allow drink service out there, which kind of was a bummer. We still decided to stay and eat at the bar. The food was awesome! Extremely tasteful and full of flavor. 

Turned out to be a great spot to stop at!
Drinks were priced ok for the strip. Happy hour was good for merely one and rockstar $8. Food is ok. Nothing special. Sit next to the riding bull if you can. Good time.

Terrible service and mediocre food. I get that this is Vegas... And you don't have to care about whether your vacationing customers ever come back but I expect way more when you are charging an average of $25 a plate.

Food was 1.5 stars, but the place gets another 1.5 stars for having a mechanical bull!  You only need to come here if you miss eating tasteless fried food.  But the dance hall has a mechanical bull, which is great for putting a wig and veil wearing bachelor on it.  Best 5 dollars I've spent!

Wanted to line dance for different experience in Vegas and we loved it! Floor is nice and big and the band was great! Only complaint is the place wasn't busy and they could have had more line dances to get people on the floor. I would advertise this place more too! Country is taking over and we should pack this place ! $10 cover is bit much to ask when we peaked inside and nobody was in there at 11pm. I would do promos, free drink ticket, etc to draw a crowd during the slow time.

I can't speak for the food or drinks because we didn't eat or drink here based on the prices and the fact the bartender was really rude, so that was the last person we wanted to give our money to!

But I CAN speak for the bull-riding!!!!!!!!!!!  To ride the gilley's bull was one of our main goals before we even arrive in Vegas, and we conquered it!!  You have to sign your life away to do it, but it was a lot of fun and well-worth it.  Plus, you get two rides, so that's always fun!!

So go for the bull-riding, but not the overpriced attitude!
It's 108 so we stopped for a beer..  The allure of the place is the live music.  We came before that.  Wasn't impressed..

Cool decor, waitresses are in black swimsuits and cowboy hats, mechanical bull is definitely entertaining, drinks are watered down, food is mediocre bar food, expect an older crowd, karaoke nights are hit or miss.
Gilleys brought out the cannibal in me, as I literally could have gnawed my own arm waiting for food. Service is painfully slow. The food is quite good. The patio/open air space is very nice!

Horrible service. Food was delicious. We could have done without the crappy attitude of the servers. We had three different people serve us, the only kind person was the guy who brought our food. The other two gals we could have done without.

Best line dancing and two stepping in Vegas.  We go here for the cute Cowboys, not the food!  The music is great and the people who turn up are chill.  It's a HONKY TONK....so you WILL hear country music! 
Whoo Hoo!!!

We were staying at Treasure Island so this was a great meeting place for the group we were with.  The nachos were good.  But I really recommend the fried chicken with mac and cheese and green bean casserole.  FANTASTIC!!  prob the best mac and cheese I have had,  bucket of beers are a good deal too!  My friend had the cole slaw which was one of the best slaws I've had in a restaurant

for some reason i didnt get any excitement out of this place... we initially came in for some beer pong but it apparently starts at 11pm... and it was about 8pm at the time... soooooo we kind of didnt want to wait 3 hours to play beer pong...
food wasnt amazing like vegas food is supposed to be.. but what ever..

it was fun watching everyone ride the bull though.

Gilley's located in Treasure Island is my go to for a country bar in Vegas. It's conveniently located in the heart of the Strip and typically doesn't have a cover till after 10pm. Gilley's has a restaurant where I've eaten one time several years ago. It's BBQ which is pretty standard for a country bar and the food is good for the price. I had the country fried steak for $17 which came with 2 sides and corn bread. 
My favorite part about Gilley's isn't the food though... it's the bar. Typically before 10pm there is no cover, and after 10pm the cover is $10 which is pretty cheap by Vegas standards. Get geared up in your cowboy and cowgirl attire and walk on in as there's usually no line. The first thing you'll notice as you walk into the bar is the huge dance floor. Whether you're into swing dancing, 2 step or line dancing, you'll get your fix. The music is almost always country (though some line dance songs aren't country) and sometimes they have excellent musicians that'll play anything you request. If you look past the dance floor, you can't miss the mechanical bull. It's not a rare thing to see girls in bikinis climb on up and go for their 8 second ride. There are contests Thursday's for the guys and Sunday's for the ladies (in bikinis). I believe the payout depends on the amount of contestants and the rides usually cost $10. The actual bar in this place is very long and there's never too much of a wait to order a drink. The one issue you'll find is there may be standing room only if you're looking for a table. The waitresses are showing off their bodies in bikinis and chaps and aren't afraid to hit the dance floor to dance with customers. 
Gilley's is a great place to go if you're looking for a bit of country in the heart of the Strip at reasonable prices and great music.

Visited March 2013

They offer good food & large portions. My husband & I shared the cowboy burger with fries & were both full afterwards. The service was very good too. Fun atmosphere. We went during the day right after they opened & it was slow. I'm sure it is packed in the evening.

Despite my previous experience, I found myself once more in, to patronize Gilleys. My wife had heard of, but not seen the place. The service was nonexistent, we had to self serve or leave, we choose the later. During our wait we were amused by the popularity of the "bullride". 

I'm somewhat surprised the place is still in operation but then again, nothing is surprising about Las Vegas.

I thought this place was weird.  It has pictures of cowgirls in bikinis all over the casino and kind of bills itself as a wild cowboy bar, but when we went there for lunch we were led to the back (with a view of the strip) and it was just kind of an old dusty place.  REALLY really old country videos playing on the TVs (non HD so they looked terrible), just a regular waitress in jeans and kind of boring.  I had a bbq beef sandwich and I thought it was OK.  I ordered a hard lemonade and it didn't taste like it had an ounce of liquor in it.  Then when we checked out, were were next to the back and could see there was 1 person who ran all the credit cards, so to check out was really slow.  I kind of thought it sucked!
Jesus the meat and cheese and deep fried greatness here is beyond measure. The waitresses are very kind but a bit busy for the tables they have to serve. But good effort!

Getting a server's attention can be a little difficult here sometimes but the food is fantastic and it's a great place to go to watch a game. Their brisket cheese fries or the pulled pork sandwich are fantastic. Honestly, pretty much everything I've had there is quite tasty. And for being in Vegas, you can get out of there with a vaguely reasonable bill.

First time at a country bar, enjoyed myself. Music was great. Although there is a charge at the door with sucks. Overall I enjoyed myself and would definitely come back! So fun one of my group members lost his shoes haha. Fun times!

Giddy Up!

The have a mechanical  bull!   Wait...  They have a MECHANICAL BULL!   

I really enjoy watching drunk people on mechanical bulls - you just cannot pay enough for this comedy.

This a country bar / bbq place with limited seating (this particular evening).   They have a large dance floor where all the ladies get their line dancing in.    The wait staff wear bikinis and chaps - it is pretty hot (male perspective).

The beer is cheap (about $3 / per domestic).   I enjoyed the evening but had to move on to the next stop.

Give it a shot if you want cheap beer and get some line dancing in.   It is one stop of many on the strip :-)

The food is gross! I had brisket it was so dry and tasted bad... had to exchange for chicken which was just ok. Beans taste like straight vinegar...yuck! Service was ok. I am from Texas and this is not Texas BBQ

You will have lots of fun here if you like bbq and riding bulls. Its located in treasures island hotel and casino you can't miss it or just ask a worker and they will show you the way. The bull riding is the best I like watching the girls get on and ride its pretty cool watching them ride the bull then get knocked off.lol the best time to go is after 6pm it really gets pumped at that time the later the better. The bartenders are real cool to I met a nice female bartender here and we went out for more drinks after her shift was over.
Waited 15 minutes for a table when there were more than six empty tables. Ordered the brisket sandwich. The meat was touch and lacked flavor. The waitress only stopped at our table once.

Not bad but for sure it is over rated. I hated hearing hip-hop music in what I thought was a county bar. We actually went there twice during our stay in Vegas and overall it was a average bar. There are bars here in Arizona where the girls wear the same skimpy outfits, and drunk girls get on mechanical bulls. 

When a girl that goes by the man "cougar" wins the bikini bull riding contest you know there is something wrong. I love cougars.....hell I love them all, but it's Vegas and that was the best they pulled in that night. 

Also every time any song came on a few people, who I am sure were paid to be there, began the SAME choreographed dance. They took up half of the dance floor, if not all of it, to attempt to line dance to non country songs. It was annoying to say the least.

The tables were filled only 1 out of 6. The service was the slowest in Vegas. ( or anywhere)  Apparently if you not drinking alcohol,  they just don't care about serving you. We came in for a birthday celebration. The food took a long time. The server just awful.
My husband's soda was never refilled until we were about to leave-which by then he didn't  want. It also was 50 degrees inside - that's ridiculously cold no matter how hot it was during the day

Ate there twice .... ambiance in the front on the strip is nice and relaxing. The bar area in teh back is so loud I couldn't hear each other talk without yelling so we left. The first meal was just appetizers, drinks and dessert and was okay but nothing special. Nachos are made with chips from a bag and they taste like it but dessert was good. Next meal was a half rack of ribs and was absolutely terrible ... dry, crusty and over cooked meat and french fries were unseasoned and stale. Was just glad I didn't order an entire rack ... won't try and eat there again.

Delicious food, hearty portions. Service was lacking a little but overall an enjoyable experience. I had the brisket fillet with Mac n cheese and broccolini and everything was fantastic! I was hesitant about the pricing but their portions make it reasonable.

For my first experience of Vegas itself was amazing, as for the food not so much.... to start my husband and I walked up to the hostess booth with two of them standing there both busy on their phones about 5 minutes of standing there they look up and a girl gave us a buzzer and we waited about 15 minuets to be seated fair amount of time for it being a Friday night can't complain...the waitress was sort of friendly not mean but not excited about being at work you could tell, then came the food....looked amazing, smelled amazing, tasted okay at best. I had gotten the half rack of ribs with a side of Mac and cheese and cole slaw, ribs were again okay nothing special kind of tough the Mac and cheese was my favorite very flavorful but the cole slaw was terrible I couldn't even eat it I can't explain the taste but it didn't taste like your average slaw just not good. The waitress was quick to give us the check fine we wanted to leave anyways. We won't be coming back to eat here.

I'm writing this while sitting on the porcelain throne. If I could give someplace negative stars, I would give Gilley's the big old moosecock. Zero. Nada. Terrible.

The only good part about this meal was that I had a beer outside on the first non-oppressive night of the Vegas summer. The bad part is that I chose Gilley's.

Maybe my palate is becoming too sophisticated for this shit, and I really don't want to be that guy. I literally couldn't eat my meal. We started with nachos - it's been months since I've had good nachos. These were covered in black olives, chili, salsa.... nacho cheese sauce. Like - movie theater nacho cheese sauce. It was never my favorite, and it really didn't seem to go right for me with the chili. My parents polished off that plate, though, so what do I know? I asked for a side of guacamole, but it never came. I think that was for the better, though, since I got guacamole on my burger.

So, I get another beer, because god knows I need it to get through the entree. My burger - in theory - sounded good. Guacamole, jack daniels BBQ sauce, a tasty burger, onion strips... bar food, you know?

Guacamole. Man, I should have known better. Guacamole is tough sometimes... if you fuck it up, you really fuck it up. Gilley's - come on. Take it off your menu. It tasted like old cheese mixed with armpit. I ended up not eating my burger and just polishing off the fries (which were good).

Final verdict? I'm literally still shitting, and this review has taken me like 12 minutes to write. Not like - just sitting here writing, but sitting here and actively releasing. I'll never eat at Gilley's again. The only way someone could drag me here would be to stare at the waitresses asses and ride the bull at 3AM.
The food was not worth the price. I would pay $7 for the $20 burger. Wouldn't go back and it was attached to our hotel!
Happy hour ! Got a brisket sandwich and a chicken buffalo wrap. One drink and the total came to $50 with tip. A little spendy  and food was ok not great.
Great service and family friendly in sin city.  The food smells great the the staff is very friendly.  I don't care for county music but I'd come back

Came in here to get away from the clubs and I was glad I did. I had such a blast here. I also brought in my cousins from out of the country and they learned how to two-step and had such a great time. 

They bartenders were quick and polite. (unlike the snobs at the clubs).

We came back for a second night this past saturday, too.

Yeehaw buckaroo!  This is the best country bar on the strip.  Our friends and I always always have to make a stop here on a Saturday before we head out late at night.  They have decent drink specials and great live country music with a huge dance floor.  

This is your typical over-the-top country bar.  It has live country music, mechanical bull riding, and ass-less chaps on the bar girls.  The service was great and the atmosphere is electrifying.  There are always people on the dance floor either doing some line dancing or some other crazy honky dancing. :) 

The wait staff was friendly but the last couple times I have been in there the waitresses have to been getting older and less attractive.  Nothing appealing about seeing a 40-year-old women in ass-less chaps.  Other than that you're going to have a great time here.

Decided to stop for outside seating and a bite to eat.... nice personality yet terrible service. Food was definitely lacking. Would not recommend this place. The cool things were the mechanical bull & the western saddle bar seats.

We came here when we were in Vegas for Memorial Day weekend. We saw the sign for Bikini Bullriding and decided to check it out. Why not!? 

It's a pretty big place with an open kitchen, large dance floor, stage, mechanical bull, bar with tables, and both indoor and outdoor seating. We arrived around 10:30 on Sunday night and found one "stool" at the bar. That's in quotes because the seats are actually saddles - love it! Shortly after, we scored a table right by the dance floor and center stage. Nice! 

We only ordered drinks since we had already eaten, but the food I saw looked good. The drinks were good - not necessarily strong, but not totally weak either. There was a band playing and singing country music (my favorite!), and people dancing. When the bullriding started, we didn't have the closest seat but a drop-down screen replaced the band on the stage, which gave us a pretty good view. The riders were just customers that had signed up or been coerced - not professionals or the staff (like we initially thought). The girls stripped to their bras/panties and rode the bull. The true winner was robbed as she was the only one who lasted without falling, but the audience chose the other girl (who fell off) instead.

The bar area is self-serve, which isn't my favorite, but the bartender made it good. He remembered our drinks and the name on the card each time, even though he was busy. He was very friendly and also gave us a round of drinks to go in plastic cups when we were cashing out. Why can't more places be like Vegas!? 

Highly recommend and I will definitely be back next time I'm in town!!

I had a fun evening here.

We arrived at around 10:30 pm and headed straight to the restaurant.  The hostess said it would be a 30 minute wait.  I gave her my best "but I'm starving pleeeeaaaase" look, and she said "let me see what I can do."  She hooked us up right away with an amazing table overlooking the Sirens of TI show.  It was a warm, beautiful desert night, perfect for outside, on the strip dining.

I had the links with mac and cheese and mashed potatoes. The food was way better than I expected!  My date had the pulled pork sandwich (same sides as me) and loved it.  The portions were generous.  We ate and watched the Sirens of TI (which was kinda lame) from the best seats in the house.

Then we went into the club, which was too crowded.  We had a couple of affordable drinks, got our groove on for a song or two, then left.

It was a fun evening of honkey tonk - Vegas style - and bbq.

The baby back ribs were an hour from being fully cooked . They were tough and cold . They had cold bbq sauce on top them . They were not like the menu says "smothered in sauce and put on the grill ". Very disappointing .  Slow service . Waitress did not ask how our meal was .
What a shit hole!!!! They have a cover for locals too!! I can't believe it,  they're crazy. Don't ever waste your time at gileys. It's not worth your time. By far the worst bar at treasure island!!

Zero stars would be an accurate review for this place. We waited for ever for our order to be taken. Our water was never brought to us. I'm writing this as we have been waiting for our food for more than half an hour. Restaurant is filled 20% at the most at this point. I'm miserable. In Vegas. I think we will miss the pirate show that we had more than an hour to and we brought kids to see it. Don't walk away from this place. Run away.

I like Gilley's more than Stoney's now. Why? because the atmosphere is much more welcoming then that of Stoney's. Maybe because it's on the strip instead of far from it? But you'd think that Stoney's would be more welcoming since it's more of a locals place, nope! I'm Asian, I get it, weird to see Asians into country, right? Well not really but I've always felt out of place going to Stoney's because of the staff and customers that frequent it but Gilley's has made me feel pretty welcomed and it makes me want to come back. 

Prices are pretty decent for the most part, luckily I wasn't paying for anything so really I wasn't paying TOO much attention to it. 

They have awesome food and your typical drinks. 

I'll be coming back very soon!

Not so good BBQ. Got the St. Louis rib platter, received a generous portion of braised, not smoked ribs.  I smoke ribs as a hobby and I know the difference between a bbq rib and a braised rib. Not tasty at all, cole slaw and potato salad sides were decent.             
     I would never eat here again, I  an amateur and I make better ribs on my Weber grill.

My one star ratings are few and far between and this is how to get a one star rating. 

My friend is here for the rodeo and she was so excited to go to Gilleys. When we walked in around 4 PM it was not crowded and I was surprised because there is a sea of cowboy hats at Treasure Island. The spaces at the bar were almost full and a few tables had groups. She found an empty saddle stool and it was a prime spot and we waited, and waited and waited. I believe almost ten minutes. Enough to talk to someone who had a drink, went to the restroom and talked again. 



There was one bartender and a back or perhaps she was a server. It is rodeo week and management did not schedule more employees? 

We waited some more and there was no acknowledgment that we existed. Sorry but this is the Strip and my expectations are high for service when you are paying a premium price. 

Sorry Gilleys but it will be a long time before I return and I will definitely check the reviews to see what the feedback is. 

We did get bucked off....

Gilley's is kinda weird.  We ordered Nachos and Soup to split.  The soup average at best and would have been better except for the dried meat chunks.  But it was hot and that's more than we could say for the Nachos.  My first bite had sour cream and I thought that's what was cold but my wife Hates sour cream and she said the same thing, avoiding it of course.  I stuck my finger straight into the center and sure enough, cold to the center.  I wish I had taken a picture.  The shredded cheese on top hadn't even melted.  They were kind enough to remove it from the bill but after acting like they might not at first.  I don't trust a kitchen to fix me more after something like that.  The weird part didn't bother me as much but my wife felt strange walking in because they have a sign having you follow the footsteps and it leads you through the dancing and party area.  You can tell lots of add-on construction has been done over the years.  Might be time for a total redo.

Worst service we've ever had. Aimee, our waitress, looked like she was on something. No interaction, no smiles and a bad attitude that will just make us never go back there again. It got us wondering if it was because we had a foreigner accent (maybe she shouldn't be working in Vegas if foreigners bother her) or because it was late at night and she was ready to go party. Horrible experience.
Words can not describe the pain of the strip food.   Vegetarian chili,  warm and from a can,  I'm sure.   Service was great, it's not there fault they ate here,  or is it?

Horrible service I went in to eat here for an all girls weekend and one of the people in our party ask for her salad first because she hadn't eaten all day. Well they didn't ever bring it out instead they decided to bring it with her entree. We were told by and employee that he didn't really care about anything we had to say about a missing salad!!! What...I have never heard of someone saying this to a customer. Wow will I never go back! 

The food is just okay everything seem like warm. Go some place else!!!

Stay far far far away!!!!!! They card 60 year old people with gray hair and kick them out because they don't know if they are 21....... but yet they took our money at the bar after we spent 300+ dollars in their bar. If I could give zero stars I would. do not waste your money!!!!

Took forever to get our food; almost an hour. Then the food we got was bad BBQ. Ribs were really fatty. Beans tasted odd. Not like make it in Texas, that's for sure. Combine that with inattentive service, and it's enough to never come here again.

We went on a Wednesday night to see mud wrestling. It was PACKED! If you want a front row seat (not really much seating) get there early.

We were hoping locals or tourists could try it out so it would be more interesting but nope, it was totally staged. The only thing people could do was PAY to wipe off the girls when they finished.

It was interesting to see and thankfully it was a free "show".thank goodness for all their drink deals!

So, in Vegas it is Quality,Price & Service. With Gilley's it is value & quality! In two visit the drinks have been a value for the money, but the staff is either lacking in volume of servers on our first visit, and initial attentiveness on our second visit. However if the lunch special is the Rib Eye for $19, I say go for it!

The food was very disgusting! Some of the waiters were really nice and when I told them I didn't like the food she took the nasty fatty brisket sandwich off the check of course we gave her the money from her sandwich to her tip she was very understanding and with a friendly attitude. Also the African American lady that's near the hostess is really nice and funny too ! I loved her anyways friendly staff disgusting food .

Had dinner in the restaurant before heading into the bar.  NOT IMPRESSED with the food.  Their mac and cheese used to be good...then they changed it.  Now it isn't any better than Kraft.  The hot links were dry and tasted like chalk.  One thing I did enjoy were the Huckleberry Tea cocktails.  
Then, we went outside to continue drinking and wait for the 10pm start time for live music.  The outside tables were sticky, covered in ants, and there was no server out there!  We asked for someone to come out and wipe the tables...no one did.
On to the bar!- The band was GREAT.  The bartenders were friendly!  My husband hates country music but enjoyed himself immensely.  I will go back and skip the restaurant next time.

Had a great time here at Gillys. If you arenhungry they got BBQ. If your thirsty, they got you covered with everything your chaps wearing heart desires. For $10 you can channel your inner cowboy and ride the bull. Buckle Bunnys too are allowed to ride and honestly alot better to look at than us cowboys. Im not a big fan of country music to be honest but the lively selections they were playing live last night were A-OK with me. 

I will definitely be back.

If the wait is long, just check out the Sirens of TI show, which is literally right outside. Our try your hand (foot?) at line dancing or even ride the bull. There's plenty of things to do at Gilley's, and if you like country music you'll enjoy the scene.

As far as food goes, it's pretty standard southern barbecue a la Vegas. Which is to say it's not especially great. Pulled pork sandwich was meh, but it was topped with cole slaw. Chili was quite good and filling.

I was surprised they didn't have the Boise St./UNLV game on, so maybe it's not the best place for college football. If I go back, it would be for a beer and some chili. Oh, and the Gilley's girls are hot.

My friends and I (5 of us) dined at Gilley's on Friday night July 14, 2017. It was my 40th birthday and I wanted to have a great time, and this looked like the place to do it. One of my party slipped on a puddle of liquid that was already on the floor outside of the kitchen as she walked back to our table from the restroom. nobody helped her up, employees saw but didn't come to her aid, somebody came out with a mop and mopped it up quickly. 

Soon after that a guy came up to our table and asked what happened? We told him she slipped on water but was okay and she said wanted to be left alone (she was very embarrassed). He asked her where the water was, and he didn't say it as if he cared, but said it like, there's no water there. I told him it was cleaned up and it was right there (near the kitchen door). He went away. Next up was another guy. He came out with a clipboard to another of my friends at the table and said "I heard you fell, what happened?". We told him it wasn't this person, it was Another at the other end of the table. Now by this time, My friend is completely embarrassed. She has said she just wanted to be left alone. New guy goes up to her and asked her to describe what happened. She said she slipped on liquid and fell but that she was fine. He started asking, well where is the water? She explained it was cleaned up already. He jokingly said, are you sure it wasn't that French fry (pointing at some food on the floor)? Come on, she is humiliated and now you're joking around, possibly implying again she fell on purpose?! Then he decided to ask if she needed an ambulance. She told him again she was fine and wanted to be left alone. He took down her information and after making us all uncomfortable, he walked away.

The waitress, who didn't care whatsoever about what happened and never even said she was sorry, took about 45 minutes to bring us our bill. They didn't even discount her plate for her fall, which would have at least been classy. Nobody apologized, they just made sure that she was not going to call the police or sue. I had such a bad experience that we didn't even stay for country music and just left. I'm very disappointed that I had such a lousy birthday dinner at Gilley's. the food was just OK. I sent a message to TI to tell them about my experience and they didn't reply. Crap customer service all around! BTW if you want to eat, you can only get appetizers in the bar area. For Full dining you get no music! Don't waste your time or money here!

I keep hearing how vegan-friendly Vegas is becoming, but that just wasn't the case in my recent experience. Even The Wynn, most hyped of major, mainstream spots for being vegan-friendly (Mr. Wynn is vegan and reportedly Tal Ronnen, of the wonderful all vegan Crossroads Kitchen in LA, created vegan dishes for The Wynn's various eateries) was a total disappointment, with just one labeled item at the buffet (there were other items, but I needed a staffer to point them out and had to ask for specially prepared stuff --- in fact, first person I asked actually said "we have tons of vegan options like... this lettuce?"). 

Shockingly, Gilly's of all places was the best! They feature a vegan entree of gardein really nicely prepared with BBQ sauce and tons of perfectly cooked veggies, including absolutely perfect garlicky baby broccoli. Total surprise here. Thanks, Gilly's, for an excellent vegan meal!

Honestly, this place is A-OK. and tha'ts not a bad thing, as people tend to think on Yelp reviews. No, this place is nice, and the reason why I have it 3 stars is because I was quickly seated at the bar with my two buddies and we ordered a beer each, $6 for a pint isn't bad given the usual Vegas prices. We didn't order the food, and it was early evening so the place was bustling but we weren't bothered or haggled for anything. The bartender made small talk while getting other drinks ready but otherwise left us to our own devices which was just what we wanted.

I can't speak for the food or anything else about this place other than if you want a place to sit at a bar on the strip and feel at peace, Gilley's is pretty spot on

We went here for lunch and I had one of their lunch specials for $12.95 which was their catfish salad. It was really good. The fish fillets were mild and tasted more like perch. The salad was a coleslaw mixture that was dressed lightly. A little tart and sweet. It was perf! Our server was kind and sweet.

I've been all over Texas and have seen a lot of country bars, and this is nothing TOO special.  It's pretty cool to have a country-type place on the Vegas strip.  At night, this place is more of a dance club. There's a cover to get in, and it's pretty packed. Tough to see anything through all the Stetsons :)

The booze is a bit cheaper here though, so if you're looking for a dance party without the high prices this might be a place to check out. 

The food at the restaurant is pretty good!  The chicken tortilla soup might be the best I ever had.  The ribs were drier than I'd like them to be, but not too much to complain about.

My husband and I came here before watching Mystere because we bought the dinner package. We weren't too impressed. The hostess was not friendly when seating us. Our server was friendly, however, our food didn't have much flavor. The bbq beans were tasteless and my chicken was dry. I'd say if you are in the area and are craving bbq and a cool atmosphere, it's worth a try.

A Hostess identified by "Irere" very very rude & aggressive. Clearly a racist an/or having a terrible shift

I was first in line at the podium, next to be seated; Irere looked beyond me an asked the couple be hide me if they were there first   

This was most disturbing & a clear case of insult bc I was obviously there first  

The couple was highly intoxicated & began to spew racial insults as I maintained composure

The MOD (Ericka) was great she called security & made sure the drunk, racist, belligerent couple was removed from the building. She also offered to comp my meal, I declined due to the hostile environment. I didn't feel safe

I believe that the hostess, Irere, initiated this entire mess; had she not started the conflict the disruption would have never happened 

This incident was racially motivated & Irere discriminated against me bc if my nationality  

I will be contacting the corporate office to make sure the higher-ups are aware of the what the employees are doing to potential paying customers

I went to Gilley's with some friends for line-dancing and really enjoyed my experience. It's a place located right on The Strip and for being in Vegas, it has as country and authentic of a feel as the country bars I've been to in the Deep South. It is a restaurant with plenty of seating on the outskirts and a bar in the middle. We came in time for line dancing lessons and one of the employees came out and taught us dances to two songs over the course of an hour. They played popular country songs and projected the music videos on a screen by the stage. There was a live band the night we went... they were okay, but I would have preferred to just have the house DJ play popular songs. They had a special that included dollar wells for ladies, can't get much more economical than that! I would love to come back here on a night without a live band because I think the dance floor would be more packed and make for an even better experience.

Yeehaw! 

Found this great little place and happy to find they had lots of things I was craving. The ambiance is fun with country music jamming in the background, some sports channels on the various TVs, and western decor throughout.

The restaurant is pretty family friendly and the staff is nice too. Our server was always on top of everything and took really good care of us.

As far as the food goes, I wasn't mind blown but it was enjoyable. Between the two of us, we shared a Cowgirl combo where you can choose from 3 meats and 2 sides. The baby back ribs were delicious and so were the hot links. The half chicken seemed like it was reheated and a bit dry but still edible. My husband ordered the green chile chili but it was not good, and more soupy  than chili. On the other hand, the sweet potato fries were nice and crispy. What I loved most is that it came with two dipping sauces. One was like a ketchup and the other was like roasted/melted marshmallows with a hint of cinnamon? It was delicious and great for sharing!

Overall a good time. My only complaint was that the food took quite a bit to arrive and we were sat near the kitchen where you could heat a loud ringing sound once in a while (the beeping of a broiler when it's ready? I don't know). Still worth checking out and a great place to share your plate.

We came here during their thirsty thursday happy hour, and because of the $1 drinks for ladies they get an extra star.

The bar seems so out of place in the Treasure Island, with the loud country music, line dancing, and bull riding. Overall the atmosphere is cool, and they had someone teaching some line dancing routine's which we thoroughly enjoyed.

We sat down at the small area in the back (which only has maybe 10 tables) and yet were ignored for the first 10 minutes until we walked up to the bar and asked for a waitress. I asked if they were doing happy hour (knowing that at some point in the night they were doing $1 drinks), the waitress said yes and we ordered 3 cocktails. To my surprise she came with 4 drinks -- apparently we ordered at 6:50 instead of 7 so they were BOGO -- at $7.50! We could have certainly waited 10 minutes had I known that was the case. 

We all ordered the vegetarian chili -- which was OK. I hadn't eaten anything all day, so I couldn't complain. We also ordered the sweet potato fries, which to my surprise came with a cinnamon frosting dipping sauce (sounds weird, I know, but it was actually very good!)

After we ate we closed the check, but continued to order drinks at the bar. Again, customer service was very meh. When I went to order drinks, I was told I could only order one because "one drink special for one person". So all of the girls had to order their drinks separately...which was annoying to say the least.

At the end of the day, its hard to beat $1 well drinks -- but when visiting Vegas I won't be back for anything else.

This restaurant was absolutely amazing! A very nice view of the strip and the food was mouth watering. My wife had the BBQ pork salad and I had the full rack of ribs with homestyle fries and baked beans. The food came out very quickly. I for sure highly recommend this place to everyone! For sure will be back!

I enjoyed the experience very much.
The mechanical bull was fun to watch people fall off.
The food was good for a BBQ and reasonable priced.
If you like BBQ and enjoy western theme stop by

If I could have given Gilley's 0 stars I would have. We  walked in, we're not greeted and then had to practically beg someone to tell us if we were allowed to sit down! Then once we sat for over 15 minutes with no menu, waitress, or attention of any kind we walked out. NEVER AGAIN.

I think all these 4 or 5 star ratings must be written by the employees here because this place doesn't even deserve one star. I'm not going to review the inside because...well...we never made it inside. My friends and I were greeted by a security guard who was looking us up and down with a dirty look, which made us feel uncomfortable upon arrival. I think maybe they're used to only seeing fat people over 50 at this bar.

We handed over our ID's and he stamped me and a friend in but when it came time for my cousin to get a stamp, the guy denied her saying she wasn't 21. Uh...yeah, she's 23! He said her ID was fake even after he scanned it and it went through. He said she must have stolen the ID even though it was her own ID and it looked EXACTLY like her! What AUDACITY! We weren't about to leave without a fight. After his bickering, he called over 5 SECURITY PEOPLE! How does it take that many people to do an idiot's job? So then they called over "the head of security" (what a douchebag!). He said he was going to refuse us service without any reason. We were completely polite to him and he still was an AHOLE. We showed him her credit cards, school ID's, everything and he said we were wasting our time!

Mind you that we had been getting into all the hottest clubs on the most poppin' nights (hassle/cover free) before we came here and were DENIED!? Plus we were guests at the hotel so we complained to the hotel later [which btw, thats another story because the hotel itself, treasure island, is a piece of crap too]. We literally just came over because we thought it looked hilarious and we were tired from dancing all night. This place is a complete disgrace and apparently, after talking to management, we found out that this place is a new development and they're on a trial lease or some sort of short term thing. 

Looking forward to laughing at this place when it's shut down :)

This bar is conveniently located on the first floor of Treasure Island, right in the front of the hotel. Treasure Island provides a two for one drink voucher for its guest so my friends and I decided to get some drinks prior to walking the strip. The drinks were strong and the cup was a very reasonable size. The place was not packed at all but it was also 2 o clock in the day. Bartenders were super friendly and nice!

Wow, on the Bbq. Family friendly, awesome food.  5 meat tray & delicious fried chicken plate. Family of 6 and we had way too much food. We had to have the peach cobbler & strawberry shortcake for dessert. The cobbler was good ol' home cooked southern cobbler with a delicious crust -at its best!

We stopped by here Friday night 5/8 on a whim after seeing Journey and stayed for about 5 minutes.  To start with, the doorman had the personality of a snail that had just been stepped on so that always starts the night off well(sarcasm inserted).  When we walked in, it seemed like a dump actually.  My wife was going to order food but they have a funky layout where you have to go into another part of the place to do that which was more effort than we were willing to spend.

The music that they were playing when we walked in was supposed to be a mixture of Eagles, Journey and Classic Rock according to their description but it was more Conway "I lost my dog and then my home after I drank my face off," type of depressing Country which helped hasten our departure since we were actually in an upbeat mood.

A solid 3. I wouldn't necessarily seek it out, but if I were staying at Treasure Island again, I would probably come back.

Ordered some specific "beer-tails"...beers with other booze in them, and they made them well. It was happy hour, so all of the shots were doubles for the price of singles...cool.  We also got the tater tot nacho appetizer thingie and our friends got the pork slider app. We enjoyed both.

I decided I wanted to...no, NEEDED to...ride the bull. So I bought my ticket at the bar ($5, reasonable) and a person promptly came over to operate it. I rode it the first time...for a SOLID 26 seconds. I thought I would be done, but the guy told me to go again (he probably just wanted a good laugh) so I did.....and I only made it 4 seconds that time. Then he told me to go AGAIN...but I was like, YEAH RIGHT BUDDY...I'm not here for your comic relief LOL. 

Cool place, giddy up.

The bar/dance hall is just a riot! The service is friendly and the nachos are out of this world! I'd say the only downsides are the free "lessons" are super short and aren't repeated throughout the night, and the guy in charge of the bull makes every girl jiggle and flop around. How 'bout letting us ride the dang thing like a real cowgirl?! Not everything needs to a be a tit show. Monday is locals night and for the most part everyone is friendly and open to visitors. I'll come back every time I'm in Vegas!

Quite possibly the worst BBQ I have ever had, overcooked meat, the brisket looked like obertos beef jerkey with sauce on top. The meat was so dry luckily they give a large drink so you don't choke to death.

3.5 stars for cheap Jameson, somewhat decent food, and a fun patio.

Never thought I'd be a Yelp app regular at Gilley's, but lo and behold, there was my golden checkmark (of shame). I visited a while back with Dana S (the S is for Some Hot Bitch) where we got cheap Jame-O and loled at karaoke. 

Visited again recently for food and more drinks, and I was not disappointed (but then again, I was not paying). The nachos were alright--tasted like my beloved Taco John's  which is a pretty good compliment coming from me. The chicken strips were just that--frozen animal flesh fried in un-food batter and grease--but the vinegary mustardy sauce sold me. Also had a bite of the jalapeno grits which were the highlight of the meal.

Overall, not a terrible place, but not the best either. The Strip has so much more to offer but in a pinch, this place wasn't horrible.

Gilley's proves you can open up anything on the strip, and people will show up. This would be a VERY average neighborhood sports bar, anywhere outside of Vegas. Once you put something very average in Vegas, it becomes below average.

The food is typical sports bar fare: burgers, sandwiches, wings, nachos, etc. Highly salty and very average. It's not bad, but it's certainly neither creative or gourmet.

Being a bar, and being in Vegas, I was hoping for some decent selection of beer. Nope. They carry the big breweries only. No drink specials either. We ended up spending $50+ for two people for a pretty average meal (and that's being generous about it.) The staff is a lot of younger women, but not the hottest servers I've seen, by any stretch. They looked tired and service was pretty slow. I feel sleepy, just thinking about this place.

And if you think I'm rating it low because it's a 'cowboy' theme or not the classiest place in the world, you couldn't be further from the truth. I love casual, laid back and non-pretentious places more than I do the upscale. This place is merely getting by, because of their location. It won't take long for people to find better places with the selection in Vegas.

Cowboy Up!!!  This is a really fun country/western club that we like to visit when we're in Vegas.  I still miss the old location inside the old Frontier....but those days are long gone.  This one isn't bad, but I don't like the entrance when it's crowded.  It's really difficult to get through the crowd, especially if you want to get to the other side, which has more tables and seats.

The night we went, there was a good band playing and plenty of people out on the dance floor.  I've never tried the food here.  Too many choices to eat in Vegas.  This place is strictly for partying for us.

Return Factor - 80%

The food was delicious and the views inside the Venetian was spectacular.
Great staff too.

Bartenders were awesome! They all seem to be very attentive and will ham it up with the customers. At least with my group they did. 

Food: it was okay. Typical bar food. Can't go wrong.

Place is fun to watch people being thrown off the mechanical bull. Live bands are generally always fun and its good "yeehaw" music. 

Come in if you're gambling in TI.

Great food and huge portions. I've you're hungry, this'll do it. If you care about flavor, this is a good choice. Right on the Las Vegas strip in front of the Treasure Island Pirate show, you can't miss it.

We went during the day so didn't probably get the full Gilleys experience but what we got was a understaffed bar the person that was there did her best and was nice and friendly the food on the other hand was not good I had there ribs which were not that good I have had better ribs at a Chilli's

It's about  1100pm and it  looks like it's just starting to get people in.  It is a Sunday after all, it's the bikini bull-riding night.  For the record I'm not here to ride the mechanical bull. 

It is quite entertaining to see the one step-shuffle-two step!  It totally takes concentration  to not look so awkward.  Our server Tiffany was super friendly she was really accommodating!  Thank you Tiffany the marshmallow molasses dip was delicious!  

We ordered the sweet potato fries and peach cobbler for a late dessert..winner!  You definitely will not be disappointed.

The atmosphere was super upbeat and lotsa fun. I've learned that people just wanna dance and have a great time!
Food was good but service was terrible. Our server didn't do anything besides take our orders, and the place was empty! Not at all the service that we had expected.

Sat at bar for 20 minutes with no service, chose a table and received no service for one hour despite multiple attempts to get service. We were told "you're in the bar area"... ok, so no one checks on drink status? Pros: Great music from DJ, reasonably priced drinks, but don't expect much else.

This review is only for the bar that's located in the restaurant side. Our bartender, David, was rude, looked bored, and didn't want to be bothered by people looking for drinks and food. He honestly looked like he hated his job (and life). I can deal with shitty food, but shitty service pisses me off. Apparently Gilley's is where washed up bartenders go to die.

My friends and I came here for dinner on a friday night and it was so crowded, not to mention really pricy. So we decided to stay for drinks and giggles. It was a lot of fun watching drunk people being thrown off the mechanical bull. I also thought it was pretty cool that the workers showed off their skills on the bull. This one guy was standing on the bull, for a very long time. Lol. I was impressed. They also have line dancing, which is a lot of fun and the people were are so friendly. I loved it!!! :)

Great food. We had to wait a long time to get seated but once we did we loved it. The servers were prompt once we were seated and gave us enough time to get back to the room to change for a night on the town.

Ordered a chicken quesadilla and sliders.  The quesadilla was not good.  Very bland and it was super thick with cheese, chicken and it had tomatoes and onions which do not belong in a quesadilla.  The sliders were very bland too and the bread was soggy.  I would not come back for the food.  The service was okay.  The only thing I really liked was the ambiance.

Normally nature dictates that bulls mount heffers but come on down to Gilly's on Sunday nights for their bikini bull riding contest and you can lay witness to a cringeworthy role reversal.  I don't know off-hand what the "winner" gets paid, but let's just say self-respect is going for pennies on the dollar.

This isn't to say you won't be entertained, especially if your daily vocabulary includes words like, "trainwreck" and "shitshow" or if you find it impossible not to stare when your visit to Baskin Robbins happens to coincide with a special ed group outing.  Rather, this is to set the expectation that you won't see shapely bikini models flashing their lady bits as they gyrate their way into your spank bank.  Instead, prepare to watch corn-fed big'uns getting tossed around like sacks of potatoes.  If that's your thing, welcome to hog heaven.

---

Cliff Notes Version: It must be jelly, 'cause jam don't shake like that.

My GF and I decided to eat here we hadn't had much to eat all day and by this time it was pretty close to 5pm.  I ordered the ribs and my GF ordered the Chicken Fried Steak.  The ribs were not that good, they seems a bit dry and tough on the top part of the rib almost like it had sat under a heat lamp for a while.  I wouldn't order those again.  I had a bit of the CFS and it was ok nothing special.  Overall I wouldn't go back for the food, the service was ok.  The only really nice thing was the view of the strip and people watching.

For affordable yummy comfort food to soak up the previous night's alcohol, this place is perfect.  On a recent sunny Sunday morning, this restaurant had no waiting for an open window seat.  We loitered for over an hour soaking in the sun and enjoying tasty wings, green chili and sweet potato fries.  

We had tried some fancier restaurants while in town hoping for a few superior dining experiences and were disappointed.  This place gave us exactly what we were looking for at that time.  Attentive service, yummy food, reasonable price and a low key atmosphere.  Exactly what the doctor ordered.

This restaurant is located in Treasure Island.
The food is really good there service is also good but they take too long to bring your food to your table for a party of 9 people you will wait about an hour and thirty minutes

The bar n activities were fun. The bill, not so much. It was "help of southern Nevada" night. The flyer on the tables said, 'two for one cocktails'. We had 8 total, so expected to pay $8 for 4, not all 8. Imagine my surprise when bill showed all 8 at $ 8, for $ 64.00. I kept the flyer showing gilllys name on it n 2-4-1 cocktails. 
Asked bar tender, what's up with bill?  Was told it wasn't a gilllys deal n was only for a rum drink. Flyer doesn't say or show limit to choice. Mgr apologized, but wouldn't correct charged. 
Drinks weren't very strong, which is unusual for gilllys. Bar tender knew we were ordering extra drinks because of 2-4-1, but never corrected drink specifics. Mgr didn't care. Felt ripped off n cheated. Go there annually, on Vegas visit. That ends now. Will miss Gilllys, but won't b cheated. Have flyer, if anyone wants it sent to them. Just ask kngpn59@comcast.net.

I think this place had a lot to offer. We mainly went here to see the 'Pirate show' next door, however unknowing to us it was cancelled.. We got nachos, quesadilla, soup, and a brisket sandwich. Holy Moly. I posted a picture of the box of nachos we got (doesnt do it justice) that box was packed full! SOOOO many nachos. And they were so so good too. There was nacho cheese on almost every chip, even down at the bottom. The chilli was stuffed with meat- it was mainly meat and hardly anything else. Which was awesome. Quesadilla was a little off. Cheese and size was great but the chicken inside was pretty dry and didnt fulfill that want i needed. Brisket sammy had a TON of meat in it. And it was all tender and delicious. If i come back to vegas id probably go here again.
(We ate outside so cant comment on service of anyone since we got our food to go, but it was pretty quick)

Gilley's is a fun stop with or without kids. The food is good and the service great.

We were at Gilley's a few weeks ago with our grandson and had a great time. They have a huge menu and the food is really good. We loved their burgers and fries, and their mac and cheese in pin wheel pasta was a huge hit with our grandson.

The place is large and if you avoid the weekend, you might even find room to dance. The music is good and not too loud.

The servers were very friendly and our food was hot and well prepared. We will be back.

Don't go for karaoke, great food but the karaoke host thinks he is Garth brooks. He is a little man with a big God complex, there is to much karaoke in Las Vegas to put up with such a bad Josh. He will put his friends in before any outsiders, if you are visiting his friends will sing 7 to your 1 song. He used this was a request just to sing and he does line dances so he can sing, it's a karaoke show not a line dance show so you can sing. Since he couldn't get a show in Vagas he thinks he has his own show here. Sorry kids shows don't play this late, get a life and do your job, I suggest gillys food but not karaoke.

Second stop on our staycation/birthday celebration it was great live band on a Saturday night high energy and mechanical bull I forced my son to ride drunk it was great he rode it twice definatly will go back
Food was horrible, had tortilla soup and quesadillas and both were incredibly bland,  no flavor to them at all, very disappointed.

Open air dining facing the strip and an outdoor patio with a view of the pirate ship is a great start, but sadly the slooooowwww service and average food will not bring me shuffling back to this Honky Tonk.

This is a Country Western bar at night and a family restaurant during the day.  Lots of cowboy decor, a bar, TV's and lots of tourists at this restaurant located inside the Treasure Island Hotel and Casino.

We had the pork sandwiches and they were okay, a mix between sweet and spicy and a lot of messy.  Overall forgettable.

Kids menu was offered so that's always a plus. The grilled cheese sandwich was served on a huge piece of Texas toast not optimal for little mouths.

Macaroni and cheese was a side dish my son ordered and I had to take a bite and it was very very tasty, I should had that instead.

Service friendly but a 45-minute wait for food (during lunch) for just a few sandwiches was ridiculous.  

The check took forever to come too and waitress didn't come around much.

Typical tourist prices $60 for two adults and two kids, if you're in the mood for BBQ go to Famous Dave's!
Food wasn't worth the price. Service was very poor sour waitress came to check on us one time. I am not impressed and will never return
No one is going here for the food.  Primary audience is the mid life crisis group ogling the girls.

Total gip & they don't know how to make drinks! The bartendr doesn't know between a Lava Flow & a Miami Vice (...here's a hint, frozen strawberries in the Lava Flow)! Go back to bartending school Dumb-A. Also ehen they gave me too much rum in my rum & coke, I asked for a taller cup with a bit m9re coke... he gave me the same cup but poured some of the drink out, so less rum, & added more coke bit still charged the same high price! Bartenders today, most of them, do not know how to make drinks! Sad considering how much they f'ing charge these days! I can make better drinks at home & spend less & probably have better atmosphere & more fun! Save your $ & go elsewhere or better yet stay home!

Wasn't bad, wasn't good, honestly - we went because we were waiting on the show. 
Seems like a lone star steakhouse with the girls wearing booty shorts in the country bar side. 
Just not what I'm into I guess.  We ordered drinks then had to order them again, we asked for no salt on the margarita (twice) and still got it. Just not something I would do again, with all the terrific places on the strip.

We didn't get a chance to order anything due to the lack of staff. After 35 minutes of being passed over, I went to the bar to order drinks. I prefer to wait to be acknowledged by the bartender versus yelling for their attention but I made the wrong damn choice. Not only did the bartender not acknowledge me, she got a towel, and starting wiping the counter, facing me, damn near in my face, and not saying one single word. So I got the guy on the other side and ordered my drinks.

Before I went back to my seat, I wanted to observe the waitresses and people around our table. The 2 groups that came in after us had drinks. After getting the story from my crew, and the other tables, basically our table was being overlooked.

Now it was manager time. I explain this episode and his response was 2 girls quit last week and he's understaffed. And I mean he kept the excuses coming. Not once did he take responsibility for the actions in his restaurant.

I'll pass on this place.

Waitress nice, bartender not so nice. I walked up to the bar to get my mother the wine list.  Before I even opened my mouth he looked at me and sighed.  Said that the waitress would be with us and that she is out there somewhere.  Both bartenders looked at me like I was from mars and shouldn't be in that bar.  Bad vibe.  Fun watching the old timers country dance though. Beer was on special 3.00 but got a small shot of fireball and paid 7.50 Ouch.

Wow. Just...wow. 

Horrible, horrible, horrible. 

We didn't even sit to TRY and enjoy anything- food, drinks, or football- because everyone was just so rude. 

We are from the Bay Area and wanted to watch the Oakland/Detroit game so we put on our A's jerseys, headed to Gilley's, and asked one of the workers if he could change one of the tvs in the corner that NOBODY was watching... He just laughed at us and said "Who would want to watch THAT game?" and just walked away......obviously us when we are dressed in Athletics gear and asking you to change the channel. We gave him the benefit of the doubt that he may have been joking...but when you joke with guests/customers, you say something to CONNECT with them, not be a total douche.

So then, we asked the bartender. He hesitated and said "umm..I'm kinda busy. Let me ask my manager." he comes back and says "we're not going to change it" without any reason as to why. 

What's frustrating is that if we had our boyfriends with us (who were going to meet us half an hour later at Gilley's), they would have changed it.
UNFORTUNATELY for their waitstaff, my friends, boyfriend, and I all have worked in restaurants for over 5 years. Generally it's a 50% tip we shell out because we know what it's like Even with bad service, we leave 20%. Definitely sucks for them because we LOVE to spend money!

Needless to say, there will be no next time for us because everyone here was just SO rude. I give 2nd chances. This place doesn't even deserve a 2nd look.

We came here without making any reservations and had to wait 15 mins for a table. Strange thing was when we were seated, we saw so many empty tables which made us wonder why we had to wait so long...

Then came the ordering - we had to waive them over as it took them a long time to take our order and once they did, we probably waiter another 40 mins for our food to arrive. The food was so so. I got the baby back ribs which were decent but the cream corn was too spicey (peppery) for my liking. Portions were HUGE so half rack did it for me.

Slow service and decent food.

This place has a lot of potential to be an awesome country bar.  Unfortunately, in a lot of areas, it fails to meet that potential.  There are a few staples every good country bar needs:
mechanical bull - Check
Cowboys - sort of check
Good music - Check (the house band is suprisingly good)
Good dance floor - Check

Where Gilley's falls off track is the crowd.  I don't know if this is a result of a strip location and too many weird tourists or something else is going on.  At any rate, this bar just had a weird vibe and lacked the feel good atmosphere of most country bars.
Will never go back again. Absolute worse service I've ever experienced!

We only ate here because it was the more appealing of two choices we had as part of our Mystere dinner package. Senor Frog's was sadly closed. Despire that fact, we were pleasantly surprised with the food. The beef my friend and I shared and the pork my other friend had was very tender and flavorful. The cheesy tots and fries were also good. The chicken was bland though and the mac and cheese tasted like it came from a box. I think we got our money's worth since it was part of a package.

I've driven by this place probably 500 times on the strip and I've never eaten here and wanted to always sit out on the little patio so I finally came in tonight and guess what I was told the patio is closed are you kidding me it was 75 and sunny today it's an absolute beautiful day but I can only sit outside for drinks


I ordered the half chicken which was overpriced $22  I mean at least give me the whole chicken for 22 bucks. it was more like a quarter chicken and
It was actually very dry I would probably give it 1-2 Stars my friend had the garden burger says was not that good. Vegetarian chili is basically minestrone soup with some extra seasoning so they shouldn't call it that just collect soup 

OK now the positives Lindsay the hostess supersweet.  The chili and the baked beans were very good I just wish my half chicken was better (so dry)....

Why am I not leaving 1-2 stars because I love the loud country music and I love the patio I'm just sad we couldn't sit on it tonight I think management should  consider opening the patio to eat at when it's this beautiful in February and 75° out because I know damn well in the summertime it's gonna be closed because it'll be too hot and it doesn't make sense because all the other restaurants on the strip with patios have people sitting on them that's why you built the patio use it

After eating up and down the strip for a week this place ended up being THE WORST experience we had.  We came for lunch to find no one was in sight to greet or seat us.  Due to the fact we walked quite a ways to get there since we wanted "good BBQ food," we seated ourselves and waited over 15 mins for a rude server (Sonia) to approach us.  The overall service she provided was less than good and the food was very expensive and barely edible (the ribs were cold and chewy).  Stay away from this place. There are so many better options on the strip.   This was a TERRIBLE experience.

Nobody to greet for 5 minutes, then told to wait fifteen minutes and the place hardly had anybody in it. For a place on the strip in Vegas attentiveness should be first. Finally seated and waited another ten minutes just for a couple ice teas while looking around the empty place and the manager and wait staff chatting with the bartender, who was busier than any food servers. Lame, finally got asked to place an order and we asked for the check, the BS'ing cowboy at least covered the soft drinks and we were GONE. Hoping it was just an off day, the food looked great, but we will NEVER know.

Its open from 11am to midnight. on this weekend during the National Finals Rodeo, they had performances all weekend long in the saloon. There was a cover charge of $10 for this weekend only. Otherwise entry to the saloon is free. There is a separate entrance for the restaurant and the saloon. we were seated quickly. they had a variety of choices on the menu. I ordered the BBQ hotlinks with japalpeno cornbread, BBQ beans and creamed corn. LOVED the creamed corn. The beans were a little tart for my liking. I should have sent the hot links back. They were cooked to a crisp. Usually hot links have some juice but this had nothing at all. The hot links sat on top of a piece of bread with grilled onions and tomatoes. I had one link and shared one with the others in my group. after dinner, we paid our cover charge and headed into the Saloon. they have one bar, the bull riding and a large dance floor. there are tables in the back of the saloon and chairs along the bar. The saloon is also where the kitchen staff is cooking the food. Usually its behind a wall hidden. i should have asked about my hot links :)

So, myself and 3 others stopped in to grab some country style cooking and listen to some live country music. However, after seeing the food which is basically set up cafeteria style, and seems like the same quality, we decided to pass on the food and just grab some drinks. We didn't expect to pay what we did for wells but they didn't skimp on the alcohol. The live band was awesome and definitely the highlight of the bar. Overall, I'm not sure if it should be labeled as a country bar or just a country restaurant with a country theme. Serving food at 1130 at night 10 feet away from the dance floor doesn't make the scene very exciting for either  atmosphere.

Came here with a party of eight.  Two of us got our food right away and the other dishes came out about 10 minutes later.  The food was cold and the service was horrible.   The steak and baby back ribs were dry and average in taste.  The corn bread was bite sized and tasted terrible. Waiters didn't refill drinks, and never asked if we needed anything.  Don't come here, there are much better choices.

We walked in and asked to sit at the bar at 11:07am. We were told there was no bartender so we had to sit at a table. We ordered the drinks we wanted and then 10 minutes later when she asked for our food order, we let her know we only wanted a drink. She said that the tables were only for people eating food and stepped back so we could get up and leave .... Worst place and worst service ever. There was no one in there. You would think they would welcome any patron.... NOPE!!!! We are now at Rockhouse; having a great time! :D

It was very greasy! The wine glass was plastic which for some reason seems contrary to having a glass of wine! There was no meat on the fried chicken just fry. It was empty which should have been the first clue. Service was fine.

Our group was in LV for the "Big Game". We had just got  to TI and we're looking for a place to eat. We sat down in the restaurant area and waited about 10 minutes before a waitress showed up. We gave her our drink order and waited about 15 minutes for our drinks. Ordered our food and it arrived in less time than it took to get our drinks. I ordered the BBQ combo with Ribs & Brisket. The Ribs were OK but the brisket was overdone and dried out. My side of beans were excellent and the coleslaw was bad. Slow service, mediocre food, we probably should have chosen another restaurant.

Great beer selection.
Friendly staff.  
Don't wait for a table, ask to sit in the lounge...

Excellent food and service.  We had buffalo wings, pulled pork and brisket.  Also the sauvignon blanc is delicious.  Perfect location on strip w nice views and people watching as well. Would definitely go back and encourage everyone to try it.
Great vegan option! Was nice to be able to get a side other than fries. Very filling option! We split "The Vegan" between 2 of us & it was plenty!

Honestly the best chili cheese fries (& tots) that exist on this planet. The cheese sauce and chili mixture is in perfect proportion to the skinny cut fries. The tots are great, but the fries are better. 

I also ordered the side of Mac and cheese. Great texture but I would've liked a more cheesy taste. 

Service is alright. Kind of slow. 

Overall this is a great place to go in vegas for some inexpensive food, specifically appetizers. The portions are also HUGE.
Very enjoyable time getting few drinks and doing a little dancing. Live singers were great. Comfortable atmosphere and bull riding too. :)

Been here a few times for parties while in Vegas. While I can say I'm a huge fan of the uniforms and beer prices, watch yourself on the liquor. Prices are night club high!

WHEN YOU GO- Go for the beer, country music, mechanical bull and the servers. Don't go for the authentic BBQ, the real sh*tkicker bar ambience or real cowboy/cowgirls. This is Vegas. This is also the Treasure Island Hotel-Casino. This ain't the real Gilley's.
Lower your countrified expectations just a little, have some beers and enjoy the views.

It was my first time in Las Vegas. I had my full itinerary for the whole weekend. A co-worker recommended Gilley's for the hot girls and the bull riding. Anyhow, we went there for lunch and there wasn't any hot girls and no bull riding. I realized that is for night time. We were seated on the other side of the restaurant for lunch time. I ordered the BBQ Short Rib. The BBQ short rib is definitely on the expensive side however this is the best BBQ short rib I've ever had. It melts in your mouth with the matching awesome bbq sauce. It had crispy onion straws on top and it was just amazing! The mashed potatoes and mac & cheese were awesome as well. I forgot what my boyfriend ordered but he had enjoyed his meal as well. I'll say the most memorable meal we had in Vegas. I highly recommend this place!

Wanted something not quite so claustrophobic, expensive and dressy and Gilleys fit the bill. The place is big and airy like a Texas steakhouse.  Prices were reasonable. My wife and I split a meal and got a few sides and left full. BBQ was good. My wife loved the Mac and Cheese. Hush puppies were fine, but not crazy about the sauces. Ended up using catch up as well. A separate waitress ensured out drinks never went dry.  Nice open windows along the outside for view of the strip or dancing and mechanical bull inside.
