First time here was expecting delicious food since this place was right on the strip came in only for the fact that we were starving and we just wanted to sit down and eat unfortunately we were very disappointed my son ordered a grilled cheese with a side of mac & cheese the bread on the grill cheese was so thick and so hard there was a little bit of cheese on there and the mac & cheese was more noodles then cheese I had ordered a barbecue pulled pork burger with coleslaw and I'm glad I got the coleslaw on the side because it literally tasted more like pepper then anything else my pulled pork had very little barbecue sauce and was not no where near the best my hamburger bun at the bottom was completely soggy Pricewise very expensive spent about $100 for a burger pulled pork sandwich grilled cheese not coming back ever

So on our second night in Vegas we decided to eat at Gilliys restaurant. The atmosphere was great, the $5 draft beer, and the Bacon cheese burger topped with blue cheese, fried onions, and bbq pork. My wife had a bowl of chili, which she really enjoyed. Server was attentive and nice, but we were not even finished eating and she asked if we wanted anything else and slung the check on the table. Bam!!!! Thumps up for food taste, and portion size. We didn't wait long for food and the server did do a good job.
I waited quite a while for my food to come. And the food was below average. I could've just go to Mcdonalds rather than spending $30 for nonexistent service and the long wait.

My cousin and I purchased a dinner & show package for Cirque de Soliel and decided to eat here as our dinner option as it seemed fun and had menu items (from the set menu) that both of us would eat.  I wasn't too impressed.  The service was not good and they didn't even try to offer us anything else aside from the set menu, which we would have liked.  The portions are huge, way too much for one person to eat and you can't really take leftovers back when we were headed to the show.  our waiter was non existent most of the time and was too busy flirting with the other waitresses.

I wouldn't come back.

This place in Treasure Island is so fun! I stop by to dance and to eat! Locals night Monday and Friday's are my favorite. DJ Shaddix is so nice and will play all the line dances that you want. Trent is an awesome bartender and I just need to look at him to get my usual drink!

Line dancing tips:
Wear Boots or something that will slide on the floor. I see so many people try in flip flops or heels and they look like they are going to break an ankle. Ouch!
2-step is really fun if you have a good leader. On locals night there are a lot of good dancers. So just ask and you can generally get a Yes. 
Some more advanced dancers will add a bit of flare, but the general steps are more basic. Try to follow along or ask someone in between songs to show you off the dance floor or off to the side. Most people are very nice about that. 
Gilley's does offer lessons at 7 or 8pm most days I can't remember which.

On Mondays a few tips. $1 drinks for locals till 10pm. A lot of locals will be there and they are REALLY good dancers. The locals get annoyed with some of the drunk tourists, but at the same time the drunks will get mad at the locals. They claim they need to practice in order to know what they are doing. The locals dance a few nights a week and definitely get their practice in. I agree that the locals on Monday's should be a bit more inclusive of people just trying to learn. I know that I help when I can. I suggest that you try and control your liquor and practice respectfully and don't bump into people. ha ha. Drunk dancing starts about 11pm if that is what you are really into. Or there is a Senor frogs down the way that offers that all night. 

On Fridays a few tips. Bull ride watching on Friday's are my favorite because there tends to be a bachelor or a bachelorette party and they put the person who is the most intoxicated up there. It is $10 to ride the bull. I will not be getting up there. Toughest Man-Bull riding competitions that they do every so often are fun to watch. They also do bikini bull riding on Sunday's if they get enough girls.

The food is also really good. My favorite is the pulled pork sliders. 

A few things that would make it that much more spectacular:
Better drink specials on Friday's. For a local, it can get pricey on Friday's.
I wish you could have food in the bar area after 9pm or at least appetizers.

We were in Vegas from july 22 until 26 and we ate here one the 23rd. My husband and I decided to eat here. Our first choice was Senor Frogs but the wait there was a 20-30 or 30-45 if you wanted to sit outside. Even though the atmosphere at Senor Frogs looked like fun (there was a live show of sorts), we had build up a hunger from shopping all day long and decided to take our chances on Gilley's. We were seated immediately near the window. We had a great view from the strip there and if we turned around we were able to catch the pirate show. 
Our waitress, Catalina was a very nice girl and when we decided on appetizers she even gave us the advice not to start with the nachos grande plate because it was huge and it will spoil our dinner. So we started with the chicken strips.They were good, crunchy and a bit spicy. We had two dips of choice, one was barbeque and another was ranch. My husband and I usually enjoy the ranch sauce, but this one we kept doubting over. Do we like it or not? We decided that it had weird tangy taste, as if they used a lot of lemon in it. So we emptied the barbeque sauce. 
For dinner my husband had the baby pork ribs, with a side of corn and fries. I had the steak with the side of corn and fries. The steak was a bit luke-warm when it arrived and I am a very slow eater, so that turned my steak to become a bit cold. It wasn't a big deal for me, the steak still tasted good, but I would prefer a very hot steak the next time. My steak was sometimes a bit too burned, which caused me to scrape some of the burned bits off. 
For my husband the baby pork ribs slided right of the bone and I could see that he was really enjoying his food. For the side the fries were good, crispy and small very nice. We got two pieces of corn, but the corn was too buttery.
We both enjoy our corn un buttered and it had us cleaning off butter from our corn. 
Other than that, we were treated really well, our waitress, Catalina was a very nice woman. 
The view is nice and fun as well if you catch it around the pirate show. We saw the other ship coming in and battling with the other one. Lots of fun, imagine if you would catch a seat on the patio!

Soggy ass burger buns, weak ass drinks, expensive mediocre sweet sweet sweet ass food, shitty ass service. Do yourself a favor, go to McDonald's and smother your food in their BBQ sauce, better than this place. GARBAGE.

This is a great place for casual drinks and appetizers...  beautiful view of the Venetian and Palazzo from their restaurant.  I suggest the giant pretzel and the onion rings...  Yum!  Good prices as well!  I recommend going early as the restaurant tends to fill up rather quickly.

I was expecting so much more. It was well over an hour wait for me to eat... for 1. On my way to be seated, I see a bar, where I could have been seated but wasn't. I got the 4 top.  ?? While waiting I drank at the bar and dance club part. Half the place was roped off, so it appeared to be packed, but because most of the space was dance floor and no one would venture there,  and half the bar space was blocked off... It appeared to be very busy. Bartender would take my empty beer bit not offer to refill. 
The line dance lesson was 10 minutes. 1 dance instruction and the run through. 
 Let me move onto the food and service. I told my waitress, "Alex", my drink order 3 times before she got that right. She gave me directions to the men's room, and then the food... to her credit, she did tell me to order the pulled pork. But I didn't want bbq pork. I wanted to taste my meat. So I order brisket. It is nearly inedible. There are chunks of fat on it. The French fries have no flavor or seasoning, seriously. Not 1 drop of anything. So if you like that, have at it. I could make the same at home with frozen fries and an oven. The bread was a poor choice for the bread since it took a fork and knife to pick up and after 1 bite, the bread fell apart. 

So, as in trying to choke down my worthless $35 meal and write this, I hope you go to Gillys with your expectations low. This bar has chicks in bikinis and chaps. There ya go. That's all it has.

Love it everytime we visit Las Vegas. 
Good music, bikini bull riding, good food/drink prices, good karaoke nights, line dancing. Basically everything a country club should be.

I expected good things from this place. It's in Vegas... has hot waiters in cowboy hats... country music ... AND a mechanical bull... come on. Although the ambiance was fun, the food left a lot to be desired. 

I ordered the fried catfish. The portion was HUGE, but the fish was not fresh at all. They were basically pieces of catfish dipped in batter and then fried. The first piece I had I couldn't eat. They left on the dark meat and if the chef knew what he was doing, he'd know that that's where the blood is concentrated in the fish, making it taste fishy. I ditched that piece and ate one with only white meat, and it was obvious that the cat fish was not fresh. It tasted like it was frozen or has been sitting out for too long. They also overcooked their corn on the cob, which is something that annoys the daylights out of me when it comes to most American restaurants. 

My boyfriend had brisket, which he didn't seem to be too happy about. I tried a piece and it was a little dry and hard, not moist, melt-in -your-mouth, fall-off-the-bone like a proper bbq should be. 

However, I will give them props on their hush puppies, which were delightfully flavorful. I also enjoyed the green bean casserole, but I could've easily made that at home...  

I don't agree with having to pay a cover charge to stand in the dance hall... even though we ate there. So, we didn't get to watch any bull riding. Will not go back again.

I got the country fried steak and it was good but later walking the strip my stomach felt off like the food was too heavy (grease).  The mac and cheese was good but overall I feel like this place was just decent.  Our server was nice but this isn't a spot you HAVE to come to in Vegas.

Located in Treasure Island, this transplant from Memphis is a great spot. A wide selection of BBQ,and lighter fare for those of you who refuse to enjoy yourselves. There is a Foursquare check in special: Three Dollar Budweiser and Bud Light drafts! Try the Hog Wings, think Buffalo Wings but made from pork shanks, these are unreal. Also I should point out scantily clad waitresses (thats for those of you not into BBQ and Foursquare specials). Wait at least an hour after eating before riding the mechanical bull!  Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

Nothing really to report from this location. We only had beers without food. The beer was an average selection that you can get anywhere. The service was go up to the bar & order so nothing big there. Just another bar with a bull & huge dance floor.

We absolutely enjoyed it here! $8 for a cranberry and vodka and $6 for a Modelo draft. We ordered the nachos, and they easily feed 3-4 people. Marci, the bartender/server was very friendly. Highly recommended!

Staff was great and talkative. Drinkwise they didn't have exactly what I wanted, but the bartender got it as close as possible and the drink was great! Food was wonderful as well and overall the price wasn't bad!!

We were desperate so we stopped at Gilley's without looking reviews. There were 8 of us so we all got a little bit off the menu. Everyone pretty much hated what they ordered. My burger was had absolutely no taste to it. We all ate our food because we needed something to soak up the alcohol not because we actually liked the food. I expected more from a restaurant in Las Vegas.

Short and sweet... I loved the atmosphere of Gilley's.  We went on a Friday evening around 8 so the bar wasn't too packed at that point.  Great people watching in the bar area.  Loved the music.  It was a mixture of country and rock.  The wait to be seated for dinner wasn't too bad.  The food wasn't as bad as what I have read in previous reviews.  The ribs, chicken and sides were good.  My only complaint was the service time, but that's to be expected in a restaurant right on the strip.  I will for sure be coming back.
They check IDs if you order take out.... food has big portions though! My friend and I were not able to finish a kid's meal, and we're 22 year old girls! WORTH!

Great Place to be on a Sunday night, Love those Cowgirls, All those beautiful Cowgirls dancing and having fun,they have the Bikini Bull Riding Contest every Sunday nite, Its FUN, beautiful ladies riding the BULL,Great Service from more gorgeous ladies,and GREAT COUNTRY MUSIC and LIVE BANDS, If you see "SMILEY", say Hi, she's a lovely African American Bull Rider, and she really knows how to tame the BULL. Great Place , Lots of FUN. WE ALWAYS HAVE A GREAT TIME HERE !!  How bout them Cowgirls, how bout em boys !
Talk about bullsh@t how did the price go from $8.00 for an rum and coke to an week as$ rum and coke to $9.00 in less then an hour. Also, ignored by male bartender for 5 minuets.

I can't speak for the food at this place since we had just stuffed our faces before venturing over here for most of the rest of the night.  We were a bit disconcerted with the $10 cover charge at first, but we quickly forgot about it after snagging a table with a great view of the mechanical bull and adjacent to the bar. The band (Scotty Alexander) was really good, playing a good variety of country favorites and a few of their own originals.  Our table proved worthwhile for some great bull riding viewing of people of all ability (or more accurately inability). Maybe best of all though was our bill after about 4 hours, 4 captain and diets, 4 blue moons, and 2 shots was about $90 with tip. Not bad for drinks considering we were still on the strip. Too bad I am not into light beer much since they had $1 light beer (I think bud light) for sale while the band was playing. Even though the place doesn't have the classic vegas ambiance, this place might be a new go to for me when looking for a no frills, affordable, good night in Vegas.

I was there last Saturday night..  What a blast my friends and I had.  The place is kinda small so if you plan to stay and dance the night away like my friends and I get there early, like 6pm-- they have early bird drink specials.  I am surprised at how reasonable the prices were for the food and drinks.  I had the tortilla soup, it was super good.  I considered it one the best tortilla soups I have had.  I had a ceaser salad, but how can you mess that up.  

Grab your boot, and a dance partner.. It's a fun time!!

My visit to Gilley's was A-OK. I wanted to enjoy my drinks and meal here a lot, but in all honesty it was just an average dining experience! The restaurant itself is clean, and has an adorable country vibe to it! Loved the music, location, ambiance, etc. But, I would say the food itself and all other aspects were just average. I ordered a classic margarita (2/5 stars), and the half-rotisserie chicken (3/5 stars).

A plus is that it did seem to be one of the cheaper places on the strip to grab drinks - especially during happy hour! After my table ordered just the regular sized drinks, we realized what a great deal it would have been to get the large - boot cup sized drinks! I believe it was only $14 dollars or so... What a great value. I would come back to Gilley's next time I visit Vegas because it was a fun vibe and conveniently located. However, I would definitely switch up what I ordered!

Atmosphere was nice. Great views while eating! Food was okay, the chicken friend steak with green bean casserole and cream corn were really good! Not a huge fan of the chipotle chicken sandwich though. Ribs were good but some parts were a tad bit tough.

I came here because I wanted to try their Spicy Deviled Egg appetizer . It sounded good because I love spicy foods and Deviled Eggs so I thought this would be perfect. This is one of those places that confuses salty for spicy. The only way I could eat these were to take most of the filling out . I was not happy paying $8.00 dollars for this. My husband ordered the Bob Wills Burger that had Jack Daniels BBQ sauce, Guacamole and Pepper Jack Cheese on it. I tried some of it ..and it was good but not worth $15.99. Personally I think the Western Bacon Cheeseburger at Carls Jr. is more worth while. I think you are paying for atmosphere ..but I couldn't even carry on a conversation because the music was too loud. It wasn't what I normally prefer because I like to chat during my meal.

The waitress was very rude. We were a party of seven, and asked them if they would sing happy birthday. She very rudely told me, they don't do that. Then they wouldn't let us eat our birthday cake there. The party was over, and so is our plans to ever return.

"Hey! Let's go to that joint!"
We ended up at Gilley's because nobody in the group I was with could decide on a club. It was a Monday night and there was almost nobody iin there, except for some creepers that were chatting up the bikini clad waitresses. 
The dj played top 40s and every so often the video screen would have a country song and the video. I wish they played more country music, I was definitely in the mood for 2-stepping! 
I loved the bar, the seats were saddles and the bartenders were super friendly. I would definitely come back for a low key evening, but next time I'm not going to wear a dress so I can ride the mechanical bull!!

Delicious food, amazinggggg drinks and awesome customer service!! Got so drunk here and it felt so safe and such a fun time! The servers are so bubbly and helpful! And I loved all the women I met in the bathroom! Will definitely come back!!

Had a blast!! Loved the theme , loved the barstools shaped like saddles, loved. the Lone Star beer.I loved the Meyers hot link, But the superstar is the white cheddar and green chile grits are out of this world.

The service was mediocre. My one complaint was the people in the restaurant. Although they did not stay long, they were EXTREMELY loud and disrespectful to everyone around them. This put me in a bad mood, but then the food came. The food was good and the Mac n Cheese was DELICIOUS. I would recommend this place for families that want to go out for good food. Overall, that Mac n cheese was above average for being a chain restaurant.

We started off at Gilley's having dinner at the restaurant. The food was terrible! Mashed potatoes are not made from real potatoes, but horrible boxed mix. The BBQ we ordered had a funky bitter after taste. The only good thing was the chili and corn chowder. Our server was nice enough to replace the mashed potatoes with another side. Not worth the price! We then went to the bar area where our friend rode the electrical bull...and that was fun! It was fun seeing other people country dance & ride the bull. Go in with low expectations.

We stopped in for a drink and something light to eat around noon on a Saturday. No drink menu, and the margarita tasted like Sprite. Best part was there was a pregnant waitress wearing the same bikini bottom/chaps/football official shirt as the rest of the waitresses. Surely they could give a pregnant woman something a little better to wear??

It gets 2 stars though because the pork green chili was pretty darn good. Totally unexpected after the rest of it. Just enough kick without being overpowering, and good flavor.

Not worth it!  The food is below average, service is bad, the place is not anything special.  I would not go back.  There are too many great places on the strip to go to waste your time on this rinky dink establishment.  The drinks are pathetic.  Waited for refills.  My husband had to wait for a new pot of coffee which took 10 minutes.  The extra staff who gets water etc is a joke.  Unfortunately I have no choice to give 1 star.  This place is a big 0!

I got the buffalo wings appetizer (which was bigger than expected) and I really enjoyed them, they were very spicy. My bf got the buffalo chicken sandwich and said it was pretty good but he thought the blue cheese was a bit much. 
For drinks I got a paradise punch and a strawberry daiquiri. 
The paradise punch was pretty strong and tasted pretty good, the daiquiri however was pretty weak but was super yummy. Staff was very nice and service was fast. I'd eat here again.

Went here last night with the family for line dancing and karaoke. The waitress was on point and was great! The line dancing "coach" showed up 30 minutes late and "coached" 2 obscure songs that I will probably never hear again in my life. So started the karaoke..... or really just the song night for the djs friends. The same 4 or 5 people sang 3/4 of the songs and they would only let a few others sprinkle in and they were very choosy on who they allowed and what songs. They actually told us a song was too slow that they had on their list and the next 3 songs they sang were even slower than the one they rejected us on. Two of the people in our group are amazing singers and were told throughout our time there by the other patrons that they were amazing, yet these jokers wouldn't let them on stage. What a waste. This place is in a great location and has a great gimmick but they ruin it. Get a clue.

This place is alright. Like most of the places in TI it's a little disappointing. The food isn't bad but by no means great and they have a well stocked bar. Beer selection is OK, but could be highly improved. I usually stop in for a drink or to watch a game if staying at the hotel just because it's convenient, otherwise wouldn't go out of the way to visit.

Very fun bar and just downstairs from the hotel rooms at Treasure Island. 

Good drinks and fun line dancing after a few drinks.

The only reason for the 4 stars and not 5 is the drink prices. Otherwise, great time.

This should really be 3.5, but I'll round up. The beginning was shakey. My husband and I fell in here STARVING after a 4 mile run...We got here around noon. The hostess said we'd have to wait 20 minutes yet there were plenty of empty tables. My husband peered his head into the restaurant as he was hinting to the fact of noticing the open tables. The hostess then spoke up and explained that a few waitresses were on break and that she couldn't seat anyone in those areas until they returned. We decided to wait it out 

The hostess was accurate in her estimation..it was just about 20 minutes before we were taken to our table. This is another restaurant in Vegas that offers street side seating. I love to people watch so this was perfect to me. I ordered the blackened Mahi Mahi sandwich and a salad. Oh my...was I pleasantly surprised! One of the best sandwiches I had ever eaten. It was sooooo good! My husband tried it and agreed which is surprising because it wasn't fried. He is a fried fish guy all of the way! He had even said that he wished he had ordered it. 

The salad was made with an assortment of dark, healthy, fresh, greens and a homemade vingearette. It was delicious. The meal was around $20...a bit high...but it was a great meal...great scenery, no regrets. I'll also mention that the waitress was great!

I rounded up to 4 stars because upon first appearance, I didn't expect to have such a good meal here. I thought it would be mediocre at best. I'm glad that I was wrong.

Pros: the restaurant is fairly big with a large section behind the rowdy area with line dancing, bar, and mechanical bull. The setting is pretty lively and fun with their cowboy theme environment. They also have live music which is good! The strawberry cocktail was really good!

Cons: The restaurant side, however, prevents you from seeing all this cool action unfortunately. The food is very average. The buns were too spongy and the meat was too loose. The waitress also took forever with my check. Avoid the blueberry lemonade cocktail... Too watered down and not tasty.

Overall: if you are in a pinch for a bite to eat, then maybe. Only if you want to dance or ride the bull then come but look elsewhere for burgers.

Been here twice. First time had dinner here and I ordered their Country Fried steak. It came with two sides. I had the mac n cheese and mashed potatoes. Very good in all aspects, the food came out quick and hot. After we ate our dinner we went over to the dance area. Checked out the bar and it was a bit packed, it was a friday night but I got served promptly. I enjoyed the music and the atmosphere was great.

Second time I visited I had dinner there also and this time I ordered the BBQ pulled pork sandwich. OH OH OH so delicious. They top it off with some good cole slaw and a order of French Fries. If you get seated outside you will have good view of the pirate show that is right outside of treasure island. Will be coming back for more of their great food. The staff is great, very attentive for all your needs.

I'm very disappointed with one of the staff members here, Mike- Security. I was there last night and I sat down on the edge of a hay stack by the dance floor. There was a group next to me (obviously locals or friends of Mike) who were extremely rude and drunk. I was waiting for my sister to finish dancing with some guy and out of nowhere these girls are yelling at me, stating that their group was sitting there. I hadn't spoken a word to them at this point. So, I apologized for sitting down on the edge of an empty spot. I also told them there was no need to yell at me. The security guard, Matt came up and saw that I was just sitting there and these women were acting all crazy and yelling at me, yet Matt made me move.  Then my sister and I watched as he was laughing with these women after. Very unprofessional and discriminatory. I have never been treated like this. I will never go back. I'm sad because we even stay at T. I. because we love country music and have gone every time we go to Vegas. I will now be going elsewhere when it comes to country bars.

I am surprised at all of the negative reviews I have seen for this place, because I Was blown away by how good the food was at this place.  I went with a group of 11 and everyone enjoyed the food they got.  

When I was told we were eating here, I thought it would just be a hokey theme bar that had no redeeming qualities, but much to my surprise Gilley's delivered.  We only went here to eat so I don't know anything about the bar part.

Like I said earlier, the food was fantastic.  I got an order of hush puppies before the meal, and they were delicious, cooked perfectly just like my grandma used to make them.  I also got the fried chicken as my entree, and I was blown away by how good it was.  I won't say that it was the best fried chicken I have ever got, but it was pretty damn good!

All in all I would come back here again for a meal, no question about that.  While I probably wouldn't hang out in the restaurant because its not my scene, the restaurant is A-OK in my book.

Stopping in was definitely on my list of things to do while in Vegas since I haven't had a chance to make it the one in Texas. There was hardly anyone there in the afternoon and they had lunch specials going on (till 3pm). The place itself is pretty big, apparently they have line dancing lessons in the evening and then it a full blown dance hall at night. I got the lunch special with the pulled pork sandwich, the chips were homemade and were very good. Light but still crunchy with just the right amount of seasoning. The nachos were HUGE definitely enough for a few people to share. They didn't have as much Gilley merchandise as I'd hoped to find in the store. Glad we got to go!

LOVE THIS PLACE!! Best down home, laid back place to hang out. We didnt eat here, just drank, and hung out several times during our recent trip to Vegas. We saw Jamie Lynn Spears perform one night- she was great, sweet, and down to earth. Sam Riddle was there another night. He was a panic. Great musician, and funny as well. Love watching the line dancing and the various bullriding contests. Bikini bull riding on Sunday nights was fun, toughest cowboy on Tuesdays was great... overall tons of fun. Great Country place. Sexy cowboys and girls everywhere. Waitresses run around in bikinis and chaps. Always a good time.

Loved it! Very cool country atmosphere and great bartenders. Joanna was my absolute favorite. She was attentive, sweet as can be and quick with our orders. What more could you ask for? 

We went on a Tuesday night after the holiday so it was a pretty quiet night but still fun. We got a little glimpse of the karaoke night with a pretty cool host. 
I really wanted to try the food because I hear it's awesome but we came pretty late and they had already stopped serving food. The guy and girl at the front were very nice about it though and even threw out some suggestions on where we could grab a bite to eat. Very sweet of them. No Worries though we'll definitely be back to give their food a try. 

The place as clean, bathrooms were clean, the crowd was good, bartenders were great and drinks were on point. I'll definitely be back!

Drinks were good, food was okay. Good service from the restaurant staff. You do get a lot of alcohol for your buck. The margarita was good but be prepared for a brain freeze since the smallest size they offer is 24 oz.! They also have a variety of flavored vodkas. Grapefruit and sweet tea options were good. 

The food was nothing to brag about. I ordered a chicken caesar salad. Presentation was sloppy. They basically put dressing and a grip of chicken on top of a lettuce head and it also have. It was too much work just to eat. The Mac and cheese was plain. Green bean casserole was cold when served. The burgers were huge and looked good. 

If you like cowboy music, stay after dinner and enjoy the show and cocktail waitresses with their cute cowboy-inspired uniforms.
Burgers were delicious and a good size! Service was satisfactory, got seated quickly. Food took a little over 30 minutes to come out but restaurant was fairly crowded. Would definitely be back again!

Food was ok, and service was ok. Good lunch special if you are looking for something filling but not too expensive. It is very hard to find a place to eat on the strip in vegas that wasn't too expensive and underfilling.

Oh my God I absolutely hated this place
First of all they charge a cover for everyone girls included and do they have a military discount yes but not to spouses
 So even after showing them my military ID they told me no. 
I had had a Union Jack baseball cap on when I went here and the man that charge me for my cover told me that there are no hats allowed.
That doesn't make sense because everyone in there is wearing a cowboy hat
So anyway when we open the doors to go in needless to stay there was only about 12 people inside it wasn't crowded at all I couldn't believe that they were still charging people especially girls to get into the stupid place

All of us will wearing jeans boots and high heels
If you are not dressed up like a redneck they will give you dirty looks
Me and my girlfriend were not down to be a line dancing and doing the honky-tonk dance or anything like that-all we wanted were drinks and shots. 
We had a very rude bartender that was going out of their way to not give us drinks and it was very noticeable I think it was because we weren't dressed up like hillbillies
By the way if you're not dressed up like a hillbilly you're going to get very badly treated so make sure you show up looking like a dirt bag

This is the best part security came up to us and told us that we weren't allowed to be in a certain spot that we were standing in
We were all by ourselves. 
The Valtr told us that it was for VIP only
But there was no one in the place everyone was just standing at the bar it was so stupid and my girlfriend just rolled their eyes and we're like we are never coming back here again this is disgusting. 

If you're not a redneck don't even bother
And make sure you come with plenty of cash
Because its cash only

I came here for a friends birthday on a Thursday. They have $1 drinks for ladies til 9. We took full advantage of that! It was nice and mellow since it was early. But that didn't stop people..mostly women from gettin their party going. They of course played country music the whole time. They also have lessons which was funny to watch the people try to learn the moves. My favorite part was watching the girls riding the bulls. It's always the ones that should not ride that do. The bull operator likes to get the bull to do this jiggly thing that of course causes the girls to jiggle. Mildly amusing. Guys will love it..how can ya not? Depending on the outfit she is wearing you might even see a boob. LOL
I ate here twice, because it was damn good. Sat by the bar....had the wings, pretzel, nachos, sweet potatoes and chicken fingers in the two visits. Yummy!

This has been the worst experience I have ever had at a karaoke bar. I showed up with 80+ plus people that flew to Vegas from across the country to celebrate my wedding. We heard of the karaoke bar and decided to check it out, the moment we arrived the staff was extremely rude and made us feel unwelcomed. They made racial slurs and called some of my family members obscene names. I Will never go to this bar ever again and I definitely do not recommend for anyone to go here to have a good time.

Mixed feelings on this place.  Came on a Saturday night.  The greeter at the door was awesome!  The atmosphere, the DJ, and the crowd were all a lot of fun.  But I practically had to climb over the bar and serve myself.  A wait is to be expected in a crowd, but the place really wasn't that busy. And the all of the staff members behind the bar had their back to the patrons.  I don't mind waiting while they help the other customers, but I kind of take issue when they're not helping anyone.  That said, I will likely chalk it up to a one-off night, and give them another try when I am back in town.  Because, hey, where else can you do bull riding on the strip?!
I like this place, the food is pretty good and they got good looking ladies working here.  next time I'll just get the bbq.  The steak is a little too chard.

Place is okay for something last minute. Food was alright nothing fancy but also not amazing for the price you pay. The smell outside is what drew me in only to be disappointed. Service was slow and not because it was packed. I don't see myself eating at this place again.

Now I would have given no stars if they gave the option. Now where do I start... I had my bachelorette party here and it was by far the worst place I have ever made reservatins with. Thier Mgr, Robin, Took $250 to book private VIP service for my party. We arrived and we were told by security that they had no reservation for us. Needess to say, ms. Robin was off and failed to tell anyone about our reservation. I spoke to the mgr on duty and after having to yell at the guy, we were taken all the way to a back corner where he had towipe dirty tables just so we could have a place to sit(we were promised up front by the dance floor) Then it takes 30 mins to get our designated server and she complained about having to serve us the entire time. To end the night, a stupid female security offcer kept yelling at us to "Get the F out or she would hurt people" 30 minutes before closing. Of course they were ok with adding over $100 gratuity for themselves. After our horrible night, we called that robin chick and she made promises to us she still hasnt followed through.... So if your planning a special event at this location, DONT!!! Don't let them ruin it as nobody in that building gives a crap about you or your money!
love the locals discounts! Thursdays it's buy one get one free on well drinks with local ID

Ribs were very dry and overlooked not fall of the bone. Appetizer was decent. Drinks were decent. I wouldn't recommend coming here unless you're here to dance an drink and hear drunk guys yell at their favorite sports team.

Horrible food! Horrible service! Bleh bleh.... Yuck! Hush puppies were like biting into a dry crumbling ball of flour mixed with cardboard. Buffalo chicken sandwich was like a frozen, flat, Tyson breaded chicken, on a stale bun. Served by a waitress who never offered drink refills, though we ordered $10 drinks, offered me a box for my uneaten meal and didn't bother to ask why I hadn't touched it.
Good food and service, but you are segregated from the bar completely. Can't even hear music. Minors are kicked out at 10 pm kind of dumb.

Yee haawwww Talk about racial tension. So Gilley's is a cowboy bar where they do play country music. They do have a killer cowpen to do some rootin tootin line dancing. From the Tush Push, two step, electric slide....just don't tell my heart. My achey breaky heart......So didn't try the food. I had my twins apply here - (former students of mine) and they got a job so I saw them a couple time fer some free beers. Yee ha. Unfortunately - I'm not a big country music fan. Plus I don't really like nascar. Dont drink Coors....so not my favorite place. For what it is....Bikini bull riding and mud wrestling. As long as they're not cousins....Nuff said...
Love the food and the open air when the strip windows are open! Very cool & fun space to grab lunch and spend a little time in the afternoon.
Did not eat here.  Country music, line dancing on a nice size floor, bull rides and beer.  I'm in.  Don't even care about food.  Loved it!

Gilley's is attached to Treasure Island, they brand themselves as a BBQ and Dance Club, and I'm sure that after a certain time they really let go, but during my visit, I sat down and ordered off the menu.   Let me put it this way, the chili cheeseburger was NOT cheap.  At $18 for a cheeseburger and a $2.49 upsell for onion rings it was.. just wow. Add a Diet pepsi on top of that and now Lunch is over $25.00 and more than I intended. 

However, the service was quick and polite, the food was good and filling and all in all, it was a good experience

I ate dinner there. The service was quick. We did have to wait for a table for 20 minutes. No problem, they gave us a buzzer and I played slots.  I ordered a burger with shredded pork.  The portions were big.  I could only eat the pork and I ate the burger the next day. I had their chili-very good. It was a pleasure to eat there
This place would be amazing if they just played music.  One night was nasty girls doing a bikini contest and another night was annoying lessons......really bad.....
Always a favorite stop for lunch.  Lunchtime is pretty relaxed but dinner/evening time gets pretty busy.  Good sandwiches and recommend upgrading to mac n cheese instead of fries!

I really was excited to try this place. Maybe it was the lover of country music in me, the fact I've walked past it's adorably-themed exterior, many times on the strip, or because the words meat and BBQ, ring louder than other food words. Yet, the 3-stars, should have made this Elitist, think again. 
We walked in on an early Saturday night, and was pleased it was just a 10 minute wait. We were told to head to the bar, for a drink if we wanted, while we waited. 
The bar area is pretty cool, with actual saddles for sitting on, tables, a mechancial bull, restrooms, and a large dance floor. We "saddled" up to the bar and watched as a busboy and at least 2 bartenders paced back and forth, with no one even greeting us, despite them being slow! No joke, it took over 5 minutes before someone DID take our drink order, and once we received the beer and Cape Cod, the buzzer went off, to be sat for dinner. We headed to our table.
Now, during a meal rush, I don't expect everything to be immaculate, but it was a turn off to literally sit down with a straw wrapper, sugar packet and other table debris, right near/under my feet. I just kicked the crap aside and shook my head. It take 5 seconds with a pooper-scooper, people. Show some pride, in your establishment. 
Our server was "pleasant," but not a happy lass and definitely wanting to get-through the end of her shift. She did point us out to ordering the combo with 2 sides, and splitting it, since we weren't that hungry. My boyfriend and I picked the Tri Tip, Brisket of beef, Creamed Corn, and Green Beans. The green beans were good, the creamed corn was delicious, but packed a kick (if you aren't into spicy dishes), and the meats okay. Despite them being marinated previously, they did need more and I like how there were several sauce bottles to choose from. That always grosses me out though, as I imagine people coughing, sneezing, licking their fingers and then touching the communal, plastic, sauce bottles. The jalapeno cornbread was too dry and flaky. Kinda awkward to eat and continue pinching at, after dissolving from its cupcake liner. It needed a butter and/or honey packet with it. So simple, not to expensive, but would have helped it go down. 
For the price, I likely wouldn't dine there again, but would visit the nightclub part.
I dont have a big review here.  Stopped, had a beer and moved on.  If you are only drinking you have to sit at the bar.  No open window seating for us.

this place is great!!!  my buddies and i were in vegas for 4 days and we were staying at treasure island and let me just say make sure you go here on sunday...  bikini rodeo....thats all i have to say!!!
they also have line dancing and the atmosphere is great!!

i would give this place 10 * * * * * * stars if i could

Gilley's Las Vegas is a fun place to hang out. Friendly staff and service is not bad. Its does get very busy causing minor delays in getting a refill of drinks. The food is good especially when you've been drinking ; ) I have no complaints about Gilley's.
Country music a dance floor and 2 jack and cokes for 7.50 can't go wrong with this palce...

Brought out of town guests here for dinner after reading Yelp reviews...Big mistake. Food was terrible. Baby back ribs were not cooked enough and had funny taste. The con bread and fries were cold. Mac and cheese had no seasoning and hard sticky cheese. The brisket sandwich had little meat. The meat was full of fat. The fries were cold. The table was not set, nobody had a knife. I had to steal knives from another table since our server went MIA. Being a local, many better places to eat.

I'm not a big country fan, but I do love BBQ.  Gilley's does both right, so it's likely the best country/bbq experience you will have while in Vegas.

We came for lunch around 11:30 and it was not too busy, but it did get busy after about 12:15.  We got a big helping of great service and tasty food.  I had the pulled pork sandwich, which was plenty big, and really good (B+/A-).  It also came with an abundance of fries, the long skinny variety, and they were equally tasty.

Gilley's is located right on the strip, and is attached to the Treasure Island Hotel.

I did not get a chance to enjoy the bar area, but it looks fun, including a mechanical bull.  Sitting in the restaurant area, they have plenty of televisions if you are needing to watch a sports event.  Gilley's has a fun decor, and the servers are all attractive young cowgirls, YEEHAW!

Great place on the strip in treasure island to listen to live country music. They have a dance floor in the middle of the room for like dancing and free dancing. They she a mechanical bull which is very popular. Lots of boobies bouncing all over. They are pretty good about getting the giggling to go with the beats of the music. I wish this place had some more tables but most of them time when I go I can sneak a small table to sit at and watch people.
Came here to listen to country music and all we heard was rapper shit. HORRIBLE!!!! We will never come back!!!

The bartenders are slow, it was a slow night and these bartenders are the worst. I believe he is racist cause he was serving everyone else before me and my group of friends cause we were brown. I just left because I stood there and wasn't served. Unbelievable, I'll never come in here again. I came in 730pm on Monday January 15th. I hope you guys do something about the 2 bartender working there this night cause this is unacceptable. This is the first country bar that I have felt discrimination from and I've even been to bars in Mississippi & Tennessee. Sad day in America it's 2018. I'm going to look up channel 8's number and have them come here cause this kind of behavior shouldn't be tolerated especially on the strip. I guess tips aren't as valuable if they come from brown people!Treasure island get your staff together!
Big portions, good sauce, cool atmosphere! Right on the strip and it's got a bull to ride! Got the Cowboys burger and I'm stuffed! I would eat here again.

A newer addition to the strip....Ahhh.....Not that drinking your face off makes you feel bloated enough...Add some greasy fried food in the mix and you might as well go back to the room and sleep off your bloated, carb induced coma. 

Fried catfish...fried chicken....Both were surprisingly tasty. The portions were HUGE and could feed a whole family. I would recommend the food, if you are looking for a cheaper alternative on the strip. 

Now, the drinks...

Bikini Bull Rider with  Limon rum, triple sec, cranberry, lemon sour and soda....Pink Lips- tangerine vodka, triple sec, lemonade and grenadine..yum...Then there's the I'll be your Huckleberry- firefly vodka and lemonade...all very good!

The view was great---people watching is at it's best and the server was fast and friendly.
Beers....outrageously expensive and limited selection. Food.....very good but way overpriced. Probably would not go back. Much more reasonable BBQ places with as good or better food.

I liked the pulled pork platter so much yesterday, I came back for lunch today. Side of Broccoli and coleslaw. Second time as good as the first. College games on yesterday NFL today. Not every game but enough. In my opinion, given the location and Portions the price is reasonable. Out the door $15-25 if you don't drink. You'll pass $20-$25 if you drink. Sat at the bar both times, service was quick and friendly. Spoke with the GM While eating. They do it right. Food is very good. I recommend the New Mexico chili.. it was awesome. Saw a lot of the food come out... nothing looked out of place. If you want the brisket, just a thought, come earlier in the day when it's ready to come out of the smoker. Brisket later in the evening is never as good (my opinion). Cheers!

Come here if you need a bit of southern flavor in the midst of all that is "sin city."

VENUE: Located inside treasure island hotel and opened SUPER late. So if you're not done partying and have gotten kicked out of every other place, this is a pretty good consolation prize. They play country music so if you like two-stepping and line dancing, come here. There's also a mechanical bull that you're able to try and ride if you've got the courage.  But watch out for, or just watch, the hot blond cowgirl. She'll put everyone to shame when riding the bull. Dance floor is pretty big and the place is relatively clean.

FOOD: I did not have the pleasure of trying their food since the kitchen had closed by that point.

SERVICE: Bartenders were funny and helpful. Drinks came out pretty quickly but because it wasn't that crowded that may have helped. The demographic of people that were there were a bit older than my group - maybe in their late 30s to 40s? Some were way over that. But regardless we had a lot of fun and most of us are huge country fans.

This past Sunday (February) I stayed at the Treasure Island for the first time with my family. I was really looking forward to going to the Gilly's ( Country Club) inside of the hotel. I arrived to the club and I waited at the bar area by the saddle stools for more than 10 minutes and neither of the 2 bar tenders in that area ever acknowledged me. I walked over to the other bar area in front of the mechanical bull. Waited there again over 10 minutes. A group of guys next to me even said "good luck getting service." So I thought I'd catch a bar tender as he walked by, I said "excuse me can I get a blue moon when you get a chance please?" He gave me the look of death and said he was taking care of the bar and had to wait my turn. He wasn't going in any specific direction so I thought I'd just ask him nicely to get it to me when he had a chance. He was super rude. I eventually got my beer even before the group of guys that were next to me and which had been there before me. The next time I came to the bar for a beer the bartender was nicer but seriously they need to get their customer service under control and perhaps send their staff to some trainings. They certainly left me with a bad impression as several others I see in the below reviews. Other than the bar service at the club, the DJ played good music and the ambiance and atmosphere was good. I went alone and had a good time.
Best night during our vegas stay.  Linsay the mechanical bull operator makes a great first impression and persuades those on the fence to try the bill.  Great ribs too.

I would never go again. Food was cold and not fresh. I had to send back my fries because they were cold. Service was mediocre. Although the vibe was pretty cool. 
You would get a better meal at Denny's.

Stopped here for a date / bar hopping night had a bucket of coronas & just enjoyed people watching on the outdoor patio. Very clean and great service will definitely make another trip maybe even get my girl on that mechanical bull !

Stayed at TI this weekend and chose Gilley's for dinner since it was convenient.  Didn't have high expectations so I was pleasantly surprised all around. Arrived with no reservations needing a table for 9, was told the wait would be 40 minutes which was what I expected and the entire paty hadn't arrived yet. Literally saddled up to the bar (bar stools are saddles) for a cocktail while we waited and about 5 minutes later our table was ready. We weren't. Asked for 15 more minutes and right on time the table was ready. Great choice of stick to your ribs southern cowboy food. I ordered the grilled chicken breast with sauteed vegies and white c/ddar/green chile grits. Chicken was flavorful with a great BBQ sauce, vegiew were still crisp and the grits were AMAZING! hubby had the fried catfish, perfectly crisp served with hush puppes as well as the two sides, so good. Friends had fried chicken, short rib, baby backi ribs-all were happy. A good portion for the money in Vegas and service was nice, nothing to write home about. Would come here again.

Amazing music! Phenomenal service! Just a all around amazing time! Tiffany was our server and she's the best! She never had to be hunted down, always anticipating our needs! Would be 3 stars without the service. Tiffany took it to a 5!

This is a fun place to go to located inside of the TI (Treasure Island).  A huge country bar right on the Strip is very much needed and Gilley's provides it!

They have a huge dining area.  A nice size bar and  a electric bill ...duh.  

Great food, service and music makes this a must for locals and visitors.

The worst restaurant that I've been to in Vegas. Under staffed is an understatement. The food looked good but never got a chance to get some. Waited at the table for 35 minutes and was never greeted or even served water. Went to the bar and got our own drinks. To the waitress defense, they were hustling to get things done. The management needs to be fired for failing to staff their work place. 

One star because the beer was cold and the food looked good.

They served me a drink with flat liquor.  BBQ sauce was nasty along with beans and Cole slaw. 
Nice people, nasty food.

Let me start off by saying that I COMPLETELY HATE country music, but that has nothing to do with the food here...

I noticed that quite a few people reviewing this place seemed to have bad service. Not the case here. A co-worker suggested going here for his birthday since we work right off the strip, so a group of us went for lunch. The restaurant participates in Three Square Restaurant Week (where a portion of your bill goes to the local food bank), and I greatly appreciate that they give back to a good cause. 

As for the food, I ordered off of the special Restaurant Week menu and loved it when the waitress allowed me to make a substitution for their green chile...it was SOOOO WORTH IT! It was some of the best chile I've ever eaten. Also, their portions are huge and their cheddar jalapeño tater tots are bomb! 

If you are a tourist or a local on the strip in the mood for BBQ at a decent price, this is the place to go!

My friends and I came here after leaving another bar.  Did not know they had a bull here.  Too bad the security is lame because they don't let anyone 6" and over ride it.  None of my guy friends were allowed to ride.  This place has a dance floor, some good music.  It was fun for the time being.

It's ok inside.  Fried chicken was average and overpriced.
Not sure why anyone would go here when there are other options near by...it's VEGAS!  Don't do a chain.  Do that in the Midwest.

I was only here briefly on Saturday night for a "Hen's Night" (bachelorette party), but Gilley's is a cute place.

I used to frequent Country Bars when I was REALLY young for line dancing.  
My tastes have evolved a bit, and its not really my thing anymore...and I was completely unprepared when I walked in.

There is a HUGE dance floor with people line dancing, and a mechanical bull on the other side from the entrance. 
The seats at the bar are saddles, which I think is an adorable touch.  

Service was nice.  The bartender was very cool and friendly.    Prices were standard for the Strip...expensive for me, but I don't go to the Strip really often...I spent $15 on two shots of rum, which is a bit much for me, but if we're being realistic, that's pretty standard pricing for drinks downtown. 

I can't say that I'll be back again, since its not really my thing, but I would certainly recommend it to anyone looking for a fun time at a downtown country bar.

Was visiting Vegas and needed some food and this place looked fun. My boyfriend and I sat down.. There was confusion instantly because we sat ourselves and the waitress was thrown off but the people up front didnt seat us. We ordered our food. I got pulled pork sandwich and he got the brisket filet with potatoes and brocollini. No joke maybe 7 minutes went by and our food was there. Have no idea how that was possible. The pulled pork is HUGE. They completely fill The plate with food. Which left me knocking food off left and right trying to eat my sandwich!  The meat was falling out all over the place.. No seasoning and very dry. Definitely not worth the $17. My plate looked like I didn't even touch it there was so much meat and fries (fries had no season either) I looked over and my boyfriend had ate the brisket but like nothing else. Potatoes again had no flavor.. Broccolini wasn't bad. 
If your looking for something fast this is the place.. We were in and out in like thirty minutes. But food is not worth the price.  I could have got better at McDonald's :/

We had a sweet heart of a waitress but when ours wasn't near we called Aimee who was working 5/11/12 close to mid night told us in a rude manner that she was not our waitress. Then latter on she walks by and tells us that "they ran out of food and they cant feed you" Really This chick needs to get out of the service business and find something that will fit her rude manner like WWF

Where do I begin... Ribs, mashed potato, Mac n cheese, cornbread, sausage, brisket, sweet potato fries the entire ordeal was delicious. This was our second time here in the past 2 years and we loved it even more the 2nd time around and before I forget the service was great!
Line dance line dance line dance. Don't go here if you want to dance with a girl..... and put some bull riding on the monitor's

Came here after a long walk along Las Vegas strip. A great place to go since you can see the strip from where you're dining. Food is great -- I regretted not getting bbq, which is their specialty, alrhough my Southern  Fried Chicken was totally worth their $18 dollar charge. We found our waitress overly friendly and cocky, but didn't make a dent on how we liked the place.

i went there last night and i  inquired about the buffalo wings. It was the worst experience of my life. Went to the bar and tried to order an appetizer  server was rude, condescending and just unbelievably RUDE once again. I was so excited about coming to this place! Will never return. Manager did nothing to make my experience there better. Gilleys las vegas needs to re hire.
Stopped by here had a blast Country music dancing mechanical bull buckets of beers good times
My boyfriend and I ate here for lunch while we were staying at Treasure Island. The food was delicious! We split the pulled pork sandwich and the Texas nacos. The portions are definitely huge!

Food was cold. And just not that great. For a BBQ place with the prices that they are in a location such as this. I was extremely disappointed with the quality of the food.
Service and atmosphere were good.

Stayed at the Treasure Island about 2 weekends ago and decided to stroll in Gilley's to check it out. This place is a great country bar atmosphere if you're staying near the south end of the strip. I didnt go here for the food but i did go for the night life. I don't usually like country music but this is a great place to learn line dancing, and watching live country music performances on the weekends. They also have a mechanical bull for the brave ones who want to try it out. The beer are decently priced but hardly a selection. Overall it's a great place if you want to relax. Worth checking out if you're staying in the Treasure Island Hotel.

Came in for dinner on two week nights during an exceptionally crowded convention week in Vegas. Seated myself immediately at the bar both nights and avoided a 30 minute wait for a table. Their selection of beers on tap was a little disappointing - the best beers they had, IMHO, were Samuel Adams and Alaskan Amber. What brought me back for a second night, however, was the barbecue. It was GREAT. I haven't had brisket that good since my last trip to Texas. When selecting sides, be sure to order the Cheesy Spicy Grits - I thought I had died and gone to Heaven! The prices were reasonable, especially for Vegas. I will definitely be back!

My review is strictly based on the restaurant and food as I never actually made it in the the saloon dance hall area. Let me start by saying I am a huge fan of BBQ and was very excited to try Gilley's for the first time. I was disappointed from the minute I opened the menu. I must have flipped through it front to back and back to front three or four times because I felt like I was just overlooking a section that listed brisket. Sadly I wasn't overlooking anything. Gilley's does not have any type of brisket whatsoever; not even so much as a chopped brisket sandwich. How can a place with a huge neon outline of Texas on the wall with it's original roots in Houston, TX serve not serve brisket? I know there are a lot of other types of BBQ out there and I am sure I am biased because of the fact the I was born and raised in the Lone Star state, but I have a hard time accepting a BBQ place that doesn't have brisket as at least one of it's offerings. Aside from the disappointment of not having brisket, the food I did have was definitely not anything special. We started off with the "Texas" nachos, they must have felt the need to get the word TX in there, but they were just nachos and we're a sad version of them at that. I can't take your nachos seriously when the melted cheese is a liquid you poured out of a can. The BBQ ribs, side of mashed potatoes and corn bread we're decent at the very best. I may visit the bar again at some point, but will definitely be eating elsewhere.

I had been wanting to check this place out for a while and wound up here on a Friday around happy hour with a friend who was visiting.  The bartender did not serve up service with a smile.  He asked us what we wanted to drink.  When I asked him what the specials were he responded and I didn't hear the second thing he said so I asked him to repeat.  He seemed truly annoyed and put out by this.  I guess when you mix overpriced drinks with drunk tourists you don't really have to smile to get tips?  

The happy hour deals weren't that great - 3 dollar drafts or an extra shot in your well drink, which was regularly priced.  There's a big dance floor, stage for live music, and a mechanical bull.  Seems like this place would be pretty fun at night but won't go out of my way to check it out.

County bar Vegas style!! The waitress we had was not only awesome she was do pretty. They had a live band too. If you like to line dance this is the lace for you. They have a nice size dance floor. You can also get food up till about 10 during the week, not sure about the weekends. We had a blast even though we don't line dance.
Worst service ever! And don't expect to watch your football game even if you ask! The waitress and the bartender could care less about their customers!

I wanted to enjoy this bar, and in some ways I did, but there were a couple things that disappointed me. I came here really wanting to dance, but the only music that was offered was from a live band that wasn't very good. Would have preferred a DJ. I also was surprised by the people here, everyone seemed closer to middle aged. Kind of weird. Considering I'm young and single I would have liked to hang around people my age. The bullriding was fun, but keep in mind it costs $10 per person to ride. I didn't have any food so I cannot comment. Also there is no cover charge. Overall this place has a lot of potential. Just get rid of the band, and advertise to younger people.

Not bad! Gilley's is a cowboy restaurant at Treasure Island.

My sister chose this place on Sunday night to watch the Warriors game. We were near the Fashion Show Mall and just wanted a place to sit down and get some drinks.

They have a happy hour menu until 10pm and select cocktails are $7. I ordered a midori sour and it wasn't bad.

I was pretty full from lunch still so I had a side of mac & cheese it was only $4.99. My sister and her friend ordered the sweet potato fries and it comes with a sweet marshmallow type of dip that was really delicious! I highly recommend ordering it!

I saw on a sign that Gilley's has line dancing here! It sounds like it would be fun if you're into that stuff which I'm not LOL

This wouldn't really be my first choice for a bar or dinner place but we just happened to be in the vicinity and we were too lazy to walk anywhere else. It was just okay.

I am in limbo about Gilley's. I love country music, I enjoy people watching, I tend to not care where I go after enough drinks, and so Gilley's would seem like a perfect place for this. I might not have had enough drinks in me to prepare me for the sensory overload, but I just felt out of place. 

The drinks are definitely Strip price. The cocktail waitresses, clad in bikinis and chaps, make their way around the floor rather often. One of the aspects that turned me off the most was that I signaled to be cut off when my friends were ordering drinks and the girl ignored me and brought me a drink anyways. I was planning on leaving soon and wanted to sober up, but the sale was more important than my wish. This has happened a few times on the Strip and that is a main deterrent  as to why I avoid  touristy attractions.

Firstly, the food was excellent I had the veggie burger and my husband had the cowboy burger - both were actually too big for us to finish but they were both delicious. Secondly, the hostess and male waiter we had were both excellent. Thirdly, the price was somewhat comparable to all of the other restaurants on the strip we paid around $50 for the two burgers and two sodas. The restaurant was pretty busy but didn't have a chaotic feel which was good (can't speak for the bar attached as it was pretty chaotic). The only issue we had with our visit was one of the waitresses had such an awful attitude and was very rude and obnoxious to not only us but many other customers. We put in a complaint to the manager whom was very apologetic and handled the complaint both professionally, and sympathetically. Therefore I believe that they still deserve this 5* review!

This place was definitely OK at the best I would say it was much too expensive from what it was and it was kind of a run-of-the-mill western place I'm a real barbecue fanatic and I did not find this place to be amazing

Sure as shit wasn't expecting to see THEE Mickey Gilley here. Just like I never expect to see Ronald McDonald, Colonel Sanders, or Popeye at their joints.

As soon as we walked in, I thought we accidently crashed a Geriatric Ho Down. The place was bouncing with Silver Foxes getting down on the dance floor. Well damn howdy, of course they were; the live music was performed by Mr. Gilley, himself!

We basically stopped in here to get our Urban Cowboy on with the mechanical bull, but it wasn't getting any action while Gilley was on stage. So, if you come here to get your ride on, you may not be allowed to if live music and dancing is happening. Would love to go back some day and get bucked off that bull.
I would give this place zero starts if I could. Bartenders are assholes. What's it about the local shit? Please that's bs!!!
One word. Bull! You really need to ride the bull or make one of your friends ride the bull. It provides entertainment for everyone at the bar and makes for an overall good time.

We wanted to come here with a group and they were far less than accommodating. They claimed our wait time to be 20 minutes and we waited for over an hour. They refused to join tables and spoke to us like we were an inconvenience. Very disappointed with this place.
Stopped for lunch. The pulled pork is filled with spices. Good meat should be smoked to perfection, not need added stuff. I couldn't eat it.

The initial feeling of you when you are asked, "Want to go have some BBQ?", should automatically trigger your taste buds into salivation mode.  That is exactly what happened to me, but my expectations were sadly not met.  Don't get me wrong, you can't ask for a better country bar to break in a newby into the scene, but BBq was just not up to power.  

I got to sample the rack of ribs, the famous brisket sandwich, and the country fried chicken.  All of course accompanied with a symphony of sides; home style mac' and cheese, biscuits, gravy, cornbread, smashed potatoes, and cole slaw.  Everything looked appetizing but tasting it was sadly a whole different story.

Ribs that were promised to be falling of the bone were tough.  The brisket sandwich that promised to be famous was infamous for lacking deliciousness, and the country fried chicken.... well that was actually the only thing I took to.  

However, there was an upside.  Wait staff was wonderful.  They really know how to give you that warm country welcome.  Drinks didn't cost a pretty penny and it was nice to know that it's okay to have a plastic bucket of beer on your table while you dine the night away.  I definitely will come back for some line dancing, beer buckets, and country karaoke, but won't be visiting the restaurant side any time soon.

The wife and I had a great time at the bar. We went on a Tuesday night, so they had karaoke and the mechanical bull working. The restaurant was a different experience. The meal was miserable. I ordered the baby back ribs. They tasted more like pork jerky. Very dry and tasteless. My wife ordered chicken strips and said that they were dry.

What to start with, Gilley's was alot of fun.  We ate there on more than one occasion and usually got the appetizers (Nachos and Chicken tenders).  Loved the food, a lot more than my husband and I could eat and the waitresses really took care of you even when you were just ordering drinks.  We sat out in the bar part by the mechanical bull and had great sevice even during the busy times.  

Every night they have a special theme, we really enjoyed World Famous Bikini Bull Riding.  There was a DJ and 5 girls rode the bowl and they had promotions where you could get free stuff from their sponsors.  I had a lot of fun both because of what I was drinking and the entertainment.  They have line dancing classes at certain times, you can ride the mechanical bull or just watch others partake in it.  If you want to have a seat you need to get their a little earlier than it starts or if you don't mind standing don't worry about the timing, either way you will enjoy yourselves at Gilley's.  

The waitresses are all dressed cute and they get on the dance floor at times and are very good at the line dances.  They are willing to take pictures with the customers and it makes for a great memory of your trip.  You are encouraged to wear your western wear while you are there, but not required.  

I don't have any complaints when it comes from Gilley's whether you are just looking for inexpensive food, drinks, or entertainment you can't go wrong with here.  It is located in Treasure Island on the Las Vegas Strip.

What a disappointment! Food was cold, flavorless and not as in the pictures! Our server was very dis focused we got different things then what we ordered, she wasn't that friendly... You can tell when some one doesn't like their job! Will not come back here. :( 
The only thing I like somewhat was the green chili.
I'm not a fan of country music but Yo!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! They got women doing bull riding in here. I guess I can stay for a little while.

Service was NOT good! The food was to salty and sloppy. I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with coleslaw and my husband got the southern fried chicken no flavor so I wouldn't recommend ever coming here.

Most horrible place EVER!!! WENT TONIGHT WITH MY PARENTS AND FRIENDS (FOR OUR 10 YEAR WEDDING ANNIVERSARY) My dad is a recovering alcoholic, we stopped at Starbucks so my dad could get a coffee before we go in so he has a drink. They would not let my dad in due to COFFEE. We got in a argument with the manager due to we got in the night before with me holding a Huge Rum drink and i got in with no problem. To think this bar is discriminating against recovery alcoholic is beyond my mind. I will disown this bar for life now and i will make sure everyone knows this!!!

Gilley's is an absolute blast. If you're looking for a good night out with great music and fun people, I'd recommend giving Gilley's a go. I'd suggest Sunday nights Bikini Bull Riding, it's very entertaining! I'd be getting there a few hours before Bikini Bull Riding otherwise you'll miss out on a table as there aren't many available.

Ok, so to make a long story short,  I came in tonight from CES,  looking for cool place  entertain my clients. The food, meh, the service, ugh, just bc your half naked doesn't give you a pass...

The only redeeming 1star, the band. Kick ass. I got a picture with the female singer, she was fantastic. 
 That's the only reason we stayed. We'd come back for them, as far as everything else, 0 stars.

It's Las Vegas, service should be perfect.

Disappointed. Had the baby back ribs and they were overcooked and didn't have much flavor. For $25 I expected better. Mash potatoes were good. The food was picked up for me so I can't comment on the atmosphere of the restaurant.

On a recent trip to Vegas with the folks, we all went to Gilley's because the group decided on barbecue. I'm mad at Gilley's.

While the atmosphere is definitely parent-friendly and the prices are not that outrageous for Vegas-Strip standards, I found the St. Louis Spare Ribs to be a little dry. I also tried my boyfriend's fried chicken and it was good, not great. I mean c'mon, it's fried chicken, hard to mess up. My impression was that the sides were really the star of the show. I especially enjoyed the potato salad and the mac n cheese.

To top off the mediocre experience, the waitress charged me and my boyfriend's 2 separate credit cards twice! Me and him were splitting the bill and she managed to mess up two times in a row? What the hell! No courtesy to even tell us she made the mistake. We both found out upon checking our online bank accounts. 

Don't think I'll be returning.
Ride the Mechanical bull I dare you, I had a goodtime

Ate in the dining area, waitress was nice, food was hit and miss. The fried chicken was over fried and stale looking. How do you over fry fried chicken?! My blueberry lemonade was flat it was suppose to contain vodka, yeah right. My husband ribs smelled and tasted like rotten meat. The broccolini and mac and cheese was ok. Oh their fries were also ok. Never again.

It's a large place, but a smaller eating area in front on the strip and a larger dance floor/stage, bar and mechanical bill area in the back.  Food was good, wings were spicy.  Had the family feast there.  Just a bit more than average price for the BBQ joint (LA wise).  Get the beer towers for $25!  Best value there.
Awesome time in vegas. The food is great and the entainment is awesome.

I have been to Gilley's twice in the past and absolutely loved it!  Always recommend friends stop by for a burger and drinks!  
I recently went to Vegas for the Superbowl and went in on 02/4 with my friend for lunch and drinks.  Ordered an appetizer, drinks and burgers.  A bee landed on my burger and I told my waitress what happened.  She took my burger showed it to the manager...assumed they would get me another burger or credit our bill.  Neither was done!!!  I got the bill for a $19 burger that I ate less than a quarter of.  When I asked why  nothing was done, she said the manager said no.  What horrible management, what horrible service.  No customer service!  I will make sure to never go back or send anyone else there.  Learn that you need to treat customers with respect and correct problems like that!!!

Went for Dinner around 7pm.  We had to wait to be seated could not find a hostess.  When he showed up to seat us he looked like he totally did not want to be there.  Waitress was friendly and very nice.  Good not that great.  We had pulled pork sandwich but it's not in a bun or bread it's on a piece of garlic bread.  Mac and cheese was so bland and creamed corn was so watery 

Not our favorite place

Got kicked out last night because one of the waitresses has an irrational fear of me since she had an affair with my ex husband while we were married. (Trust me girl, I divorced the loser and don't care anymore.) She complained to management, and my friends and I were kicked out. That's it. I did not exchange looks or words with her at all. Even ordered from the bar so she wouldn't have to wait on us. I think that's pretty unfair. I could understand if I or my friends were making a scene or causing an unsafe environment, but none of that took place. I was extremely disappointed too, because the male bartender, I think his name was William, was awesome. Very polite, great service. He made drinks to perfection! I was going to order food, but was told by another customer not to, that it wasn't very good....and judging from the other reviews about the food, I'm glad I didn't.
Also, I was even told that if she no longer worked there, I would still not be welcome back. Ehhh, it is what it is, Stoney's is better anyway.... just a little further from my house.

What I liked: 1) The pulled pork burrito was tasty; 2) They let me charge my phone at the bar; 3)  The strawberry shortcake a la mode (served with a biscuit instead of sponge cake) was pretty much amazing.

What I did not like: 1) Waiting 15 minutes for a table when half the establishment was empty; 2) Our server telling us they were out of Shiner Bock even though the gentlemen seated to our right were clearly drinking it; 3) The same server and her middle management goons trying to rush us out the door, ignoring the fact that we were still ordering beers and food; 4) The girl seated behind us who didn't wear a belt. Or underwear.

To summarize...

Gilley's Food = Not as bad as you'd guess

Gilley's Service = Worse than you could expect

The food and the surrounding were perfect and the southern fried chicken was spectacular ! It was enough for my wife and I . The service is great too . Disregard the one saying they weren't scantily clad outfit . The serve parents with kids. The place is perfect and don't have to walk the bar makes what ever you want . Oh and the beer is COLD !

Came here after leaving The Koby Keith bar last night. Place seemed a lot more alive and a lot bigger. Big dance area and the drinks didn't really kill your pockets. They have a mechanical bull also which was cool. They had a few TVs that was playing sports and had a good band. I'm assuming the place was better and more alive because of its access from the strip. I would probably recommend this place over Toby Keith if we had to go by first impressions. But will try both again and update my review if anything changes.

After suffering through two meals at other strip restaurants we stopped by for lunch to watch the NCLS game. Once seated, the game was on only one of their twenty televisions. We quickly requested the game to be turned on at the closest television. Next thing we see is all the TV's tuned into the game. 

Then the food arrived, oh what a great surprise, huge side salad, scrumptious burger and the kids enjoyed the macaroni and grilled cheese, which they are fine dining experts on the subject. 

All in all, great food, great staff  refreshing surprise from the others places.

This review is just for the bar/dancing area. Haven't had dinner or anything over there yet.

Pros:

If you go early-ish (before 7:30/8) it is fairly easy to get a table, especially earlier in the week. Waitresses are also fairly attentive, again, the earlier in the week the better.

No cover! I hate hate hate paying covers. They also have pretty good drink specials

I have never been on the floor when it was too crowded to dance. Have certainly come across your typical drunk chick doesn't know what she is doing type dancers, but overall there is room to get away from those people and not be squished against the person next to you.

If you get a table next to the bull, you not only have easy access to the dance floor, but great people (on bull) watching as the night progresses.

Dance lessons M-F at 7pm. 

Music is a reasonable, can carry on a conversation at your table, volume

Cons:

Can be loaded with tourists, which can make you feel like an animal being watched in a zoo while dancing...maybe that is just an issue for me though

Everyone (tourists, regulars, waitresses, etc.) will walk straight across the dance floor, which is generally know to be fairly bad etiquette. When the floor is empty, it isn't the biggest deal but I have turned during a dance and nearly taken out a bus boy walking right through a line of dancers. 

Floor is so-so, fairly sticky as far as dance floors go.


Overall, I like Gilley's.
