The older I get, the more I appreciate the more laid back, not as loud, not charging you for everything under the sun, not being slammed into by barely conscious club girls vibe that is getting more and more difficult to find out here. Keep in mind that kids are allowed here until 10pm, which may bug people, but there have never been that many kids there. I think the general family friendliness is part of what keeps the "club" crowd away, so I'll take it.
Yeeeeehawww, well the wait was not worth the food.  Sorry Gilley's

FALL OFF THE BONE RIBS.

Amazing brisket.

Hot staff. Great price on drinks.

What's not to like, people?

I like this "dressed down-dress code" restaurant. One side is the restaurant and the other half is the bar where they have a mechanical bull. It's  free for anyone brave enough to ride it.
Not really a fried chicken lover, I probably eat it once or twice a year...I was in the mood and theirs is yummy and what a huge portion!
It's located right in front of Treasure Island, It's entrance gets blocked every hour due to the Pirate show right in front of the hotel as spectators block it's doors. Show ends in about 8-12 minutes so it's not so bad.I'd check em out again next time I'm in  Vegas.
The decor was really nice and this was in a convenient location on the strip. The drink was decent and they give you a large serving.

We came in here for lunch while staying at TI. I admit to being disappointed - the wait staff were just regular folks. Where were all the scantily clad women they have plastered all over their pictures and web site??

Anyway, service was mediocre, but I really enjoyed the food. I got the fried chicken and it came out lava hot and was really great.

Took forever to check out because apparently there's only one person working there who can run the credit cards for some reason, but eventually we were allowed to leave!

Stale dive bar that tries too hard:

Ordered the combo platter which includes pulled pork and ribs with corn on the cob, corn muffin and fries.  We arrived just when they opened at around 11am but surprisingly, the food tasted old, like it's been sitting there for awhile.  The fries were cold and didn't have the reliable crunch factor we were yearning for.  I wonder if they just took the leftovers from the Buffet tables.  The only thing decent was the pulled pork.  The entree costs a whopping $26!  Definitely not worth the money or the calories.  

Also, the service here sucks!  Older Male Bartender is really snippy, Oscar the grouch and a true @sswipe.  

If you're staying at Treasure Island, I'd recommend Canter's Deli.

Got dragged here to see/hear some band...first timer. 
Service: non existing,  sat at a table for over 15 minutes with no waitress in site.
Bathroom: 1 toilet and one urinal. Guess no one of the 100 plus,patrons in here ever use the bathroom. 
Prices: $8 for a beer...like really? 

Conclusion: another fine tourist trap on the strip. Poor service outrageous prices all fluff and zero substance.
A shame.

Truly this is a UNIQUE nightclub!! As it's Las Vegas, there are all sorts of stuff for all types of people and all over the city; so if you're looking for a cowboy club this is the place for you! Gilley's is a place that is never too crowded!! The waitresses and bartenders perform an excellent job, even beyond that; they are people who care for the satisfaction of customers (like taking pictures with them). The music gives a great mood to the place (country) and the videos they put also match with the club. It's also very cool that they have a mechanic bull. Every single time I go to Vegas, I must make at least one stop to this place!

I want to give 3 1/2 but it's just not quite 4 stars for me. 

We did have to wait a couple minutes which was no big deal. Once sat, a gentleman who we thought might be our waiter asked "do you want drinks" well sure, 3 waters. We needed some after drinking all day. 

Few minutes went by and we see the guy walking around but no waters, weird. Finally he arrives with the water and says "waitress will be with us".... okay, starving now, I start trying the BBQ sauces to keep myself busy from the minutes of passing by( we had just had bad service at the Wynn and left after 20 minutes of no service) lol pretty good so if you are waiting just start dabbling with those.

Our waitress is now here and taking our order and everything after that is really great. 
Huge pretzel was amazing, burger was perfectly cooked to medium and a nice toasted bun like we had asked. My sister also got the house salad which was very big and had great flavors especially with the field greens. Check out was a breeze too.
I thought the prices were high but after seeing and tasting what we got, not disappointed.

I'll be back again , just hopefully it's a little quicker and I'll be 5 stars all day.

Had a great lunch here.  The pulled pork sandwich came out with a great smoked flavor that wasn't overpowering and not drenched in sauce so you had a choice of which sauce you wanted at the table. Loved the coleslaw on the sandwich for that nice acidic crunch that elevates the sandwich flavor profile.  The sandwich was big enough for 2 people to share as the portion of meat was very generous. 
My husband ordered the wings and said they had a nice crispness to the outside  and the  sauce was good. He has never had a wing appetizer with this many wings on it before, so once again the portions were plenty.  
We were thinking of getting the nachos, but when we saw them come to the table next to us we changed our minds.  The portion was way too big.  At the end of lunch we were glad we didn't order them because the 3 big burly guys that did couldn't even finish them.
We were greeted by the manager when we walked in and he seated us at our table.  Oscar was there immediately to get our drink order and Isabella our waitress was a delight.  Made sure to ask the chef if there were bell peppers in the chili my husband originally wanted.   She told him she didn't think so, but would check anyway.  Thank goodness she did because the chef said he blends them.  Which means you can't see it, but it's there.  Saved us a trip to the ER for food allergy.
Very happy with lunch here and would highly recommend it.
I really enjoyed the atmosphere as we'll the free bull rides! Music was great and they had a good mic of two step vs. lines dancing so everyone could join in

Why didn't i read Yelp before i went here??? Lesson learned. I'm from Texas and shouldve known better, but I used poor judgment and came here with my wife anyways. Ive eaten pounds of BarBQue at all kinds of Texas BBQ joints and i failed to heed Rule #1: 

Don't patronize any BBQ place if you cannot locate the smoker. This place has none and their sucky BBQ and the rest of their food should be avoided at all costs. 

I thought because this was Vegas, maybe they carefully disguised their smoke pit as a fake rock or they rigged it to come out one of those pirate ships at T.I. Alas, no. 

I ordered the chicken fried steak. It was clearly a frozen rectangle patty and tasted like the kind you would find near a convenience store microwave. In fact, i thought i saw a cook run out the back and cross the street to the AM/PM and then run back. 

I don't remember what my wife had. I do remember her saying it sucked and was overpriced. The waitress was always in a hurry and literally threw our plates of food on our table as she zipped by to attend to other customers. I felt like hitting her in the head with my frozen patty. 

Much like the song of the sirens next door and the T.I. pirate show, the menu lures you in with dreams of gastronomical delights. And just like the show next door, your meal ends with a ship battle going on in your stomach because of the poor food quality. 

P.S. Gilleys: I wouldn't tout the fact that your menu claims your sausage is imported from Elgin. You re making it sound as if Elgin is this magical, mystical far away place. Its like saying your Budweiser is imported from St. Louis. So what? the rest of your food is imported from the generic food aisle of the grocer's freezer. Will never go back there again.

We had lunch here last weekend and the service was slow but we loved the food! We tried the pretzel as an appetizer which came out with two sauces. We also ordered the fried chicken and brisket and they were both very good!

Jesse is amazing. If you're here, ask for him. He was fantastically honest about everything and funny.
The food itself was amazing. I got the Texas Nachos and just ate those for dinner. They were more than enough to eat as a meal and share with someone else. We also got the BBQ sliders and those were fantastic. M
The drink specials were decent; cheap for Vegas but average priced for anywhere else in the country.

Great music, spacious, great energy and VERY friendly staff!!!! This place was everything you would expect it to be...shame on me for not realizing there was an enormous country bar behind the restaurant sooner, as I have passed it over many times. I will be coming back on every trip to Vegas going forward!!!!

I really enjoy this place. The beautiful Isabel was our server, she enunciated like Sofia Vergara trying to assimilate. Generous portions, nice view of the strip with glimpses or the wynn or the palazzo nearby. We shared some appetizers. Reasonable pricing, attentive servers, nice to go during calmer hours, and they are open pretty late.

This may be the most fun I've ever had at a bar, and that's saying A LOT since I've had some good times *coughcough*. The appetizers were nothing much to speak of so we'll just skip that part.

After a horrible time at Surrender, we decided to shed the heels and pretentiousness, put on jeans, and do some country dancing. GOOD CHOICE GIRLS. There was an awesome band (Chauncey Williams and the Younger Brother Band if my Googling is correct) and they had the place swinging. The mechanical bull provided endless horrifying entertainment as girls in skirts shoved their asses in the air. 

The bar was crowded and understaffed, leading to a bit of a wait for a drink. One bartender in particular (didn't get her name unfortunately) was a goddamn champ. Don't waste your money here. I should've known to walk away when the hostess staff was talking trash about the wait staff but I took a chance. Our waitress was horrible and after taking our order we didn't see her again until she dropped off our check. My husband's fried chicken was more like flour chicken and my rotisserie chicken looked good when it arrived but was waaay over cooked and dried out. The Green Bean casserole was the tastiest part of the meal, it had a Cajun flavor that added a nice flare. Too bad it wasn't paired with a good main course and proper customer service.

Outstanding food we had the chipotle chicken sandwich. The bun was soft as a pillow the chicken was tender perfectly cooked with a light searing. Served with onion rings. Great ambience right on the Las Vegas strip.

We know a girl who's a hostess here so we thought we'd give it a try for dinner. We went on a Monday night at about 5:30. We didn't have to wait to get a table, and were sat in the semi-outdoor seating...complete with flys. 
I'm sure its hard for restaurants to keep flysout but that doesn't mean it isn't gross. And it doesn't mean that swatting a fly for my entire 45min dinner was any less annoying. 
The service was alright, the server we had was nice but definitely too used to have food runners and bussers. A huge pet peeve of mine is sitting at a table for a prolonged period of time with dirty plates ( napkins on plates to signify being finished) while the waitress walks by, asks if we need anything thing else and brings and closes our check. The dirty plates where still there when we got up to leave 10 minuets after we received out check from out waitress. 

Now, I have been a server for 3 years, so I can understand a bad night, being busy, etc. The real disappointment wasn't the service, it was the food. I just wanted some tasty BBQ. That is not at all what I got. First of all, we ordered the nachos, which were picture in the menu and showed up completely different. They were pictured as being laid out on a plate...they came piled a half a foot high and smothered with all kinds of crappy looking toppings. 

So that happened, we ate what chips we could find that weren't soggy yet and put some toppings on them ourselves. Then our entrees arrived. I got the half of a rotisserie chicken with the mac and cheese and green bean casserole. The chicken tasted OK, but it was cold. The mac and cheese was cold, oily and disgusting...I had no idea you could mess that dish up! The green bean casserole was also cold and gel-like. : / ....My boyfriend got the fried chicken with mashed potatoes and mac and cheese. His food was super hot(which tells me that mine was sitting in the food window as his chicken was fried) but his sides were crappy too. His chicken was hard as a rock. Needless to say it was gross. 

Usually we say something when things go this wrong, but we were late for a show and we dont like to receive free food so we left and vowed never to return.

We waited 40 minutes after ordering to get our food. When it finally came it was cold. My husbands steak was medium well and he ordered medium rare. My cheeseburger had no flavor and had clearly been sitting for some time. Our original waitress left and a new waitress came to the table to check on us. We complained about the food and she sent the manager over. My husband showed him how well done his steak was and told him that our food was cold. He took the cost of the steak off the bill. This will be our last meal here. Very poor customer service.
